title: Data Analyst

description:
Edge & Node is at the forefront of web3 innovation. Our mission is to establish The Graph as the unbreakable foundation of open data. Our pioneering subgraphs set the industry standard and solidify The Graph as the premier solution for organizing and accessing blockchain data.




At Edge & Node, we champion a decentralized future based on shared values. Dedicated to decentralizing power and resisting censorship, we aim for a robust, permissionless information era free from central control, thus eliminating the traditional vulnerabilities associated with misplaced trust.




The Data Science team works closely with teams across Edge & Node to deliver high quality data for product research & development and go to market, as well as business analytics. We work across the data lifecycle from infrastructure to product analytics to APIs for user facing dashboards.




We are looking for a versatile Data Analyst who thrives at the intersection of business strategy and data innovation. In this role, you’ll respond to ad hoc data requests and streamline the delivery of insights that inform company-wide decisions. You’ll partner closely with business and technical teams, translating complex analytics into meaningful metrics, dashboards, and reporting tools. This position is ideal for someone who is not only collaborative and responsive but also eager to leverage modern data practices and pipelines to help drive our growth.




What You’ll Be Doing




 * Translating ad hoc business requests into clear data tasks and actionable insights
 * Building and maintaining dashboards that communicate key business metrics and performance trends
 * Managing data transformations and pipelines using dbt, ensuring accuracy, scalability, and version control best practices
 * Collaborating with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, engineering, marketing) to refine metrics, definitions, and reporting standards
 * Staying current with emerging data technologies and suggesting improvements to current analytics workflows
 * Ensuring timely and accurate data delivery, providing clear communication to stakeholders




What We Expect




 * Knowledge of The Graph and prior professional experience in web3 is strongly preferred
 * Proven track record of working with modern data transformation and pipeline tools (e.g., dbt) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
 * Demonstrated ability to translate ambiguous business questions into clear, actionable analytics tasks.
 * Hands-on experience building and maintaining dashboards and reports using leading visualization tools (e.g., Metabase, Looker, Tableau, Mode).
 * Strong SQL and data modeling skills, with an understanding of data warehouse best practices.
 * Prior experience collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, marketing, or finance teams.
 * Comfort with emerging analytics methods and tools, especially those that support workflow automation and scalability.




Compensation/Culture




The overall market range for roles at Edge & Node is typically $100k - $500k annually. This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary). Edge & Node has a culture that values meritocracy, personal growth, and an ego-free environment.




About The Graph




The Graph is the source of data and information for the decentralized internet. As the original decentralized data marketplace that introduced and standardized subgraphs, The Graph has become web3’s method of indexing and accessing blockchain data. Since its launch in 2018, tens of thousands of developers have built subgraphs for dapps across 40+ blockchains - including Ethereum, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, Polygon, Celo, Fantom, Gnosis, and Avalanche.




As demand for data in web3 continues to grow, The Graph enters a New Era with a more expansive vision including new data services and query languages, ensuring the decentralized protocol can serve any use case - now and into the future.




Discover more about how The Graph is shaping the future of decentralized physical infrastructure networks (DePIN) and stay connected with the community. Follow The Graph on X, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Reddit, and Medium. Join the community on The Graph’s Telegram, join technical discussions on The Graph’s Discord.




The Graph Foundation oversees The Graph Network. The Graph Foundation is overseen by the Technical Council. Edge & Node, StreamingFast, Semiotic Labs, Messari, GraphOps, Pinax and Geo are eight of the many organizations within The Graph ecosystem.

description:
Who We Are Looking For



We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst for the Procurement organization. The person will play a key role supporting several strategic projects for the Procurement Organization. We are looking for someone that is curious about all things data/business, understands how data is used in a business environment and that will be able to provide actionable insights that enables the Procurement organization to make data-driven decisions. To be successful in this position this person needs to have strong statistical and data science concepts knowledge to solve problems and make recommendations. This person will also need to work cross functionally to achieve success across projects.



What You Will Work On



You will work on a variety of projects applying different data science techniques and statistical analysis to forecast spend, cluster suppliers, build products for analysis and create algorithms towards data classification.



Who Will You Work With



You will report to the Director, Data & Analytics Procurement. Collaborate across the Procurement organization and with other data analysts.



What You Bring





 * Bachelor’s degree in business, data and analytics, statistics, decision science, or combination or relevant education, experience
 * 5 years of relevant professional experience
 * Experience with key digital marketing KPIs and familiarity with analytics tools such as Adobe, snowflake, databricks, etc
 * Proficiency in data visualization (preferably Tableau or Looker)
 * Prior experience with data analysis
 * Ability to combine disparate data sources and derive actionable insights from them
 * Ability to do data modeling
 * Basic knowledge of data science (clustering, forecasting, etc)
 * Basic understanding of Phyton or R
 * Basic understanding of data warehousing
 * Advanced verbal and written communication skills with comfort presenting results to senior leadership
 * Excellent time management and ability to prioritize multiple work streams
   
   



We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. description:
Creating A Healthier Way of Living

Rinnai America Corporation is the leader in tankless water heating, a technology that is growing rapidly as businesses and homes “yank the tank” and convert to an efficient, endless supply of hot water and the only tankless water heating manufacturer in the US. We have a commitment to our team members to provide a strong, accountable culture with a practice of giving back to our communities.

Rinnai America Corporation (RAC) is looking for RAC-STARS! Check out why Rinnai is the hottest place to work https://www.rinnai.us/about/why-rinnai.



What does a Marketing Data Analyst do at Rinnai?

Seeking a highly analytical and data-driven Marketing Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for uncovering actionable insights through data and will play a key role in shaping our marketing data strategies. You will be responsible for analyzing data from various marketing channels, identifying trends, and providing recommendations to optimize campaign performance. This role will work closely with the marketing, IT and sales teams to ensure that data-driven decisions are at the core of our growth strategies.

 * This position is located at 103 International Drive Peachtree, City 30269.
 * Other Perks/Benefits: Best-in-class health benefit programs that provide eligibility on 1st day of employment, 401k match, Paid Volunteer Community Service Day, and so much more

RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Lead administration of DAM, PIM, and Salesforce Experience Cloud platforms and ensure proper connectivity with internal and external platforms.
 * Establish and manage data governance standards, processes and audits to ensure accuracy across marketing platforms and adherence to governance standards.
 * Lead process for transition from current customer portal to Experience Cloud platform and ensure accuracy and completeness of all customer data.
 * Create visually compelling dashboards and reports communicating key customer performance metrics to internal and external stakeholders.
 * Monitor the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and make data-driven recommendations for improvements and adjustments as needed.
 * Monitor customer facing website and customer portal traffic and performance and make recommendations for future enhancements.
 * Monitor and assess competitor and other industry leading digital properties and communications to establish benchmarks and develop recommended enhancements.
 * Track leads from various sales and marketing campaigns and initiatives and leverage results for future initiatives.
 * Assist in website content management and digital communications.
 * Assist and support external digital agency management.



REQUIREMENTS:

KNOWLEDGE

 * Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing or related field or equivalent work experience.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience with digital operations, data governance, data analysis or related role, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
 * Experience managing DAM and PIM platforms as well as leading data governance and integrity processes.
 * Technical Skills: proficient in marketing operations tools such as PIM, DAM, GA4 Google Analytics, advanced Excel as well as MA platforms (e.g., Salsify, Widen/ Aquia, HubSpot). Experience with Salesforce Experience Cloud and various integrations.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Proficiency with ERP systems and MS PowerBI.





ABILITIES

 * Ability to analyze data, prepare and interpret reports, and communicate actionable results, findings, and recommendations.
 * Proven ability to proactively initiate and complete tasks.
 * Ability to work under pressure.
 * Ability to quickly assimilate and distill complex technology.
 * Results orientated, entrepreneurial, and self-motivating.
 * Well-developed interpersonal skills to build positive working relationships.
 * Must demonstrate a passion for customer service and support, exhibit high levels of commitment and energy, and integrity. Attitude and behavior consistent with company mission, vision, and values.
 * Ability to work independently and effectively within the team.
 * Ability to execute against both short term deliverables and long-term strategic initiatives.
 * Travel 5%-10%



Physical Requirements:

Physical Activities

 * Remaining in a stationary position, often standing, or sitting for prolonged periods.

description:
Overview




Alliant has developed an enviable reputation for innovative, data-driven solutions that optimize profitability in marketing campaigns. At the core of these accomplishments is a strong team with a passion for analytic innovation. To strengthen our Data analytics and Engineering teams and increase the pace of revenue growth, Alliant is always on the lookout for great talent in data analysis and engineering.




Alliant is looking for an entry level data analyst to join its Data Analytics and Engineering team. The Associate Data Analyst will be responsible for data processing, data analysis and data engineering. The ideal candidate will have some programming experience (in any language), as well as an aptitude and appetite to learn SAS. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to choose a data science/predictive modeling or a programmer/analyst career development track. This position reports to the Director of Data Analytics and Engineering.




Principal Responsibilities:

 * Move client files to analytic disks, confirm quantities, and provide summary of data assets
 * Import, examine, clean and transform data for model development and analysis using SAS
 * Execute existing and develop new programs to generate model development samples to meet the business requirements of direct and digital marketers
 * Conduct thorough quality assurance for model development samples, ensuring reliability and accuracy
 * Diagnose and solve problems with data, layouts, and dictionaries
 * Understand Alliant's statistical models as they relate to the company's production scoring system
 * Maintain and update model production schedule to assure adequate and precise timing of samples to Data Scientists




Qualifications and Skills:

 * Undergraduate or graduate degree in Math, Computer Science, Data Science or a related discipline preferred
 * Must have an aptitude for programming and analysis. Training will be provided in SAS programming.
 * Exposure to Python, R or SAS preferred
 * Knowledge of Linux, Hadoop and SQL a plus
 * Coursework in computer programming, predictive modeling, machine learning, and related disciplines preferred.
 * Experience with linear algebra, statistical methods like linear regression, and predictive modeling
 * Must be familiar with MS Excel and have well developed and organized work habits
 * Must have strong quantitative skills and extensive attention to detail with the ability to investigate raw data
 * Proficiency in technical data handling, e.g. writing SQL or Python scripts to manipulate data for 2+ years
 * Ability to clean, manipulate, and analyze large datasets to derive actionable insights.
 * Must be flexible, adaptive, inquisitive and possess a keen understanding of technology
 * Strong oral and written communication skills and convey complex data in a simple, actionable way
 * Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills are required. This isn't just about data-it's about delivering insights to our clients
 * Must have a strong interest in, or a working knowledge of, audience selection techniques for direct mail and digital marketing







The base salary for this role is between $60,0000 and $75,000 plus a corporate bonus. Alliant considers a number of factors when determining compensation, including, but not limited to, education, years of experience, levels of experience, competency levels and other relevant skills and qualifications.




This role requires working on-site in our headquarter office in northern Westchester County, New York. to foster close collaboration and team interaction.




Alliant Overview:

Alliant is a leading independent data company trusted by thousands of brands and agencies to bring a human element to modern data solutions. The Alliant DataHub — built on billions of consumer transactions, an expansive identity map, advanced data science and high-performance technology — enables marketers to execute omnichannel campaigns with responsive consumers at the center. Data security and privacy have been core values since day one, and Alliant’s continually validate our people, processes, and data through meaningful certifications such as SOC2, IAB Tech Lab Data Transparency, NQI certification from Neutronian, and quarterly quality scoring with Truthset. For more information, visit: alliantdata.com.

Alliant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Associate Data Analyst

description:
Pacific Seafood offers a unique, 13-week internship program that gives interns the chance to make an immediate impact on our company. Starting with a structured orientation week at our corporate headquarters near Portland, Ore, you’ll be able to meet the team and learn the full scope of our business. Throughout the summer months, you’ll dive deep into a meaningful project for our company, which you’ll then present to our executive leadership team at the end of your internship. For graduating seniors looking to kickstart your career, there are plenty of opportunities to stay on full-time at the conclusion of your internship! Start your professional career with us, where we can invest in your development as a business professional, and build valuable leadership, work-ethic, and team-work capabilities!

At Pacific Seafood, we do more than just provide the world with the healthiest proteins on the planet. We are an excellence-driven organization committed to being the brand of choice in the marketplace and the employer of choice in the community. We believe in servant leadership, investing in our team members, and rewarding performance. We live by the core values of our Diamond Philosophy: Quality, Teamwork, Productivity, and Excellence—which means consistently doing your best and always striving to do better.

This internship will focus on analyzing profitability on sales, categories, margins, weights and customers. Support senior analysts and managers by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help our organization make informed decisions.

Key Responsibilities


 * Data collection and management
 * Data Analysis
 * Reporting and documentation
 * Market or competitor research
 * Fillet production analysis: Monitor production statistics, such as fillet hours and fillet pounds processed.
   
   
   

Required

What You Bring to Pacific Seafood


 * Pursuit of a Business Management, Finance, Accounting, or Operations undergraduate/graduate degree
 * Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
   
   
   

Preferred


 * Cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
 * Power BI, SQL, Python
   
   
   

Total Compensation:

At Pacific Seafood, your base wage is only a portion of your overall compensation package. We invest in our Team Members through a comprehensive and attractive total rewards package, including but not limited to:


 * Employee assistance program providing confidential professional counseling, financial and legal assistance at no charge to team members and immediate family members
 * Product purchase program
   
   
   

Pacific Seafood is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
title: Data Analytics Intern

description:
Why it’s worth it:

 

As a Data Analyst at ReliaQuest, you will be on the front line of building systems and deriving insight that drives RQ and our customers’ businesses forward. You will make a tangible difference in the understanding and practice of cybersecurity, visibility into threats and customer systems, and the fast-paced innovation of RQ.

You will work on a collaborative, high-performing team to provide data-driven business decisions. Business as usual is not something you’ll see here, and we maintain a culture of innovation. You will build a strong skillset in some of our most used tools: Snowflake, Power BI, dbt, GitLab, Python, and SQL. You’ll put these tools to good use in developing analytics, designing and delivering information that excels in good storytelling, and generating impactful information for customers and your RQ colleagues.

The everyday hustle:


 * Developing data analyses and methodologies that provide visibility and insight into both ReliaQuest and customer operations
 * Contributing to innovative projects that include a variety of advanced qualitative and quantitative analytic assignments
 * Being an expert into ReliaQuest operations and how to effectively measure them
 * Providing relevant data-related reports and insights to customers, partners, executives, and ReliaQuest colleagues
 * Designing publications that are intuitive to understand and provide targeted information
 * Creating systems and tools for effective data management, visualization and interpretation (systems design, dashboards, information graphics, Power BI, etc.)
 * Identifying opportunities to drive growth and supporting implementation of continuous improvement processes
 * Staying abreast of industry trends and advancements in analytics to continuously advance our capabilities
   
   
   

Do you have what it takes?


 * Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Business Administration and Management, Business Analytics and Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics or a similar degree
 * Experience with tools such as Snowflake, dbt, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Domo, Python, R, SQL Server, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Grafana etc.
 * Excellent visual design skills
 * Excellent written and oral communication skills including an ability to communicate with internal and external cross functional teams (technical and business)
 * Strong attention to detail
 * Great attitude, energy and effort
   
   
   

 

What makes you uncommon?


 * Graduate degree in Management Information Systems, Business Administration and Management, Business Analytics and Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics or a similar degree
 * Prior experience working in advanced data analytics, data systems and/or cybersecurity analysis
 * Goes above and beyond and continuously learns new skills
title: Associate Data Analyst

description:
Job Description

Data & Analytics Intern, Capital Markets

Remote

Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 5:00pm 

Internship program dates: June 6 – August 15 

CSC ®  is the world’s leading provider of business, legal, tax, and digital brand services to companies around the globe. Our clients include many of the Fortune 500, FTSE100, CAC 40, and DAX 30 companies.

The Capital Markets Europe team provides our institutional clients with a comprehensive range of specialist debt and capital markets administration services.

We are seeking a bright, highly motivated and detail-oriented student to join our dynamic team as a Data & Analytics Intern. This internship is an excellent opportunity for individuals looking to gain hands-on experience in data analytics within a professional setting. As an Analytics Intern, you will work closely with our experienced analytics team to contribute to data-driven decision-making processes.

Responsibilities:


 * Data Collection and Analysis:
    * Assist in collecting, cleaning, and organizing data from various sources.
    * Conduct quantitative and qualitative analyses to extract meaningful insights.
      
      

 * Report Generation:
    * Prepare clear and concise reports based on analytical findings.
    * Present findings to team members and stakeholders in a comprehensible manner.
      
      

 * Tool Utilization:
    * Utilize analytics tools and software to perform statistical analysis.
    * Learn and apply data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively.
      
      

 * Collaboration:
    * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements.
    * Work closely with team members to support ongoing analytics projects.
      
      

 * Continuous Learning:
    * Stay updated on industry trends and emerging analytics technologies.
    * Proactively seek opportunities for professional development within the analytics field.
      

What technical skills, experience, and qualifications do you need? 


 * Currently attending college, university, or a similar training program (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, etc.).
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g. SQL).
 * Proficiency in Data Extraction, Transformation pipelining tools (Azure Synapse , DOMO , Power Automate etc.).
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
 * Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
 * Eagerness to learn and adapt to new challenges.
   
   

Why join our internship program?  


 * This is a PAID internship and an opportunity to grow your communication and business skills for your career and your resume. 
 * We offer multiple opportunities for professional development, growth, and networking during your 10 weeks with us. Examples include lunch and learns, networking events, resume review, and more! 
 * Our interns work in teams to give back to our communities by supporting a charitable organization. At the end of the program, teams present to a group of senior leaders, showcasing the charity, how they gave back, and what they learned. 
 * CSC is a relaxed and fun work environment – we can wear jeans to work!  
 * CSC is a great place to work with smart and dedicated people. We have been voted a Top Workplace every year since 2006! 
 * We offer challenging work and career opportunities – we love it when our interns become employees!  
   
   

We encourage individuals from diverse backgrounds to apply.

#CSC

#Internship

About Us

CSC is a global business, legal, and financial services company based in Wilmington, Delaware, USA, providing knowledge-based solutions to clients worldwide. We have offices and capabilities in over 140 jurisdictions in the Americas, Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East, and more than 8,000 colleagues. We are the business behind business.®

Visit our careers site to learn more about CSC and our commitment to our clients, communities, and each other.

CSC is committed to creating a feeling of belonging through a diverse and growth-oriented environment where everyone is valued.

CSC colleagues have global career opportunities and excellent benefits, including annual success-sharing bonuses or commission plans based on individual performance. To learn more, visit cscglobal.com/service/careers .

We offer a range of support to colleagues with disabilities, ensuring people have the necessary resources to thrive in their roles. We encourage candidates to work closely with our talent acquisition partners to convey their specific needs. Our commitment to accessibility reflects our broader dedication to diversity and belonging,

CSC only accepts resumes from employment agencies that are part of our approved supplier program. Resumes submitted from other agencies either to talent acquisition, our hiring leaders, employees, or through any other mechanism other than our supplier process, will not be eligible to claim related fees and the submitted resumes will be considered property of CSC.

We encourage candidates to apply directly to our website and not through third-party sources.

Disclaimer: The information above describes the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not intended to describe all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications.

About The Team

At CSC®, we’re always looking ahead, finding ways to improve and anticipate the future needs of our customers. Curiosity fuels our innovation and productivity drives our results. This proactive mindset has helped us adapt and create solutions that have enabled businesses to run smoother and smarter for more than 120 years.

CSC is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining talented people whose personal values align with ours. We empower our employees to bring the right solutions to market to meet customer demand. That is why we are the premier provider of global solutions for more than 180,000 businesses.


 * CSC is a great place to work with smart and dedicated people. We have been voted a Top Workplace every year since 2006 and are a 2022 National Top Workplace.
 * We offer challenging work and career opportunities. Most positions are filled with internal moves and employee referrals.
 * Employees are eligible for an annual success sharing bonus or commission plans based on role and individual performance.
 * CSC offers excellent benefits, including medical, dental, life insurance, and flexible spending and health savings accounts. We also offer you a 401(k) with employer match and profit-sharing, paid time off, tuition reimbursement, and more.
 * Our global standard for our work environments supports current and future technology initiatives through open design, sit-stand workstations, and digital interface points with wireless access throughout the campus. It’s an exciting time for us in terms of growth and expansion.

title: Data and Analytics Intern

description:
Company Description

Govini transforms Defense Acquisition from an outdated manual process to a software-driven strategic advantage for the United States. Our flagship product, Ark, supports Supply Chain, Science and Technology, Production, Sustainment, and Modernization teams with AI-enabled applications and best-in-class data to more rapidly imagine, develop, and field the capabilities we need. Today, the national security community and every branch of the military rely on Govini to enable faster and more informed Acquisition decisions.

Job Description

Govini is looking for motivated, curious, and data-driven individuals to join our team as Implementation Engineers. Implementation Engineers at Govini have a quantitative mindset and firm understanding of how to use technology and data to solve hard customer problems. Implementation Engineers are responsible for leveraging quantitative skills to configure Govini’s technology to achieve customer outcomes, communicate data-driven insights to executives in the national security community, and produce compelling program insights, data visualization, and briefings.

In order to do this job well, you must be analytical, understand people, have a strong drive to use technology to solve the hardest problems, and want to learn everything, particularly about the most pressing national security challenges confronting the nation and how data and machine learning can help address them.

You’re eager to build a deep understanding of US Government and Defense acquisition processes and the importance of effective and efficient program management, supply chain risk management, and program and technology modernization. You ask hard, uncomfortable questions. You know there are always multiple answers to hard problems, and you know how to engage in a constructive dialogue to find the best path forward.

This role is a full-time position located out of our office in Arlington, VA.

This role may require up to 75% travel.

Scope Of Responsibilities


 * Develop expertise in Govini’s clients, offerings and data, and support customers as a Govini product and data expert
 * Execute the successful implementation of software and data to Govini’s customers and provide platform training
 * Use coding languages (SQL, Python) to conduct technical platform configuration and data integration, or be able to quickly learn and implement these skills
 * Collaborate with Govini Engagement Managers and Product Managers to capture market demand and user needs for inclusion into Govini’s offerings
 * Proactively drive utilization of the product using targeted training and engagement strategies that drive mission outcomes and analytical insights for platform users
 * Develop and maintain documentation such as tailored user guide reference materials
 * Conduct research and develop quantitative analytic reports using Govini technology and data Orally and visually present data-driven findings in a concise and compelling manner to internal teams, as well as government officials
 * Demonstrate knowledge in areas such as US Government programs and operations, federal acquisitions and program management, government procurement practices, supplier assurance, federal contracting, Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution (PPBE), Supply Chain Risk Management, and Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) analysis
   
   

Depending on your background and expertise, you could also be responsible for:


 * Support the success of Govini’s clients via end-user training and user support
 * Provide technical workflow development and configuration
 * Communicate data-driven insights to executives in the national security
 * Conduct in-depth quantitative and qualitative analyses on problems of importance to U.S. national security community using data visualization, compelling written paper and briefings
 * Provide product demonstrations in support of sales pursuits efforts
   
   

Required Qualifications


 * U.S. Citizenship is required
 * Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Business Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, International Relations, Political Science, International Security or similar fields, or 1-4 years of equivalent experience
 * Intermediate familiarity / skills with Excel, SQL, Python, and R; or ability to quickly learn these skills
 * 1-4 years of relevant experience, including undergraduate or graduate roles or internships, performing national security-related analytics; preference for research, quantitative analysis, data manipulation, and data visualization skills
 * Excellent professional demeanor with a willingness to work outside of your comfort zone in a fast-paced environment without hesitation
 * Strong aptitude for solving open ended issues in unpredictable, unstructured environments
 * Excellent professional demeanor with a willingness to work outside of your comfort zone in a fast-paced environment without hesitation
 * Eligibility and willingness to obtain a U.S. security clearance
 * Outstanding listening, verbal, and written communication skills
 * Ability to manage multiple work-streams and projects, learn quickly, and work independently with little supervision
   
   

Desired Qualifications


 * 1-4 years of relevant experience in user support or user engagement with a focus on platform and product utilization
 * Knowledge of defense acquisition life cycle and program management, technology scouting, and supply chain risk management
 * Knowledge of languages/applications, such as React, Typescript, Java, C, GoLang, or the ability to quickly learn these skills
 * Experience within advisory services, software-as-a-service (SaaS), information services, analytic tools, or data analytics industries
 * Demonstrated ability to conduct relevant business case studies and market analysis using internal and open-source data sources
 * History of engaging with and presenting to federal Government stakeholders
   
   

We firmly believe that past performance is the best indicator of future performance. If you thrive while building solutions to complex problems, are a self-starter, and are passionate about making an impact in global security, we’re eager to hear from you.

Govini is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Join one of the fastest growing rewards/fintech startups in the world - Benjamin! Backed by Play Ventures and F4 Fund, we're all about making everyday actions rewarding. We're looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to help us take things to the next level.

At Benjamin, we give users real cash rewards—what we call MoMos (Money Moments)—for things they’re already doing. From playing games and watching ads to everyday card purchases with cash back, we’re all about putting money back in people’s pockets.

What you’ll do:


 * Analyze and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights that guide business decisions
 * Collaborate with team members to develop and refine data models
 * Use SQL and Python to query databases, clean datasets, and create visualizations
 * Participate in complex mathematical discussions to ensure accurate data interpretation and solutions
 * Identify and proactively communicate potential issues or anomalies in data
 * Support cross-functional teams by providing relevant data and reports
   
   

What we’re looking for:


 * Recent or soon-to-be graduate, preferably from FAU
 * Strong analytical skills with a focus on data accuracy and critical thinking
 * Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis and manipulation
 * Confidence and comfort in engaging in complex math and data discussions
 * Proactive communication skills to flag and address data concerns
 * Flexibility to work a minimum of 3 days per week in the Boca office
 * A strong preference for candidates who are new to the workforce and excited to learn our systems and processes
   
   

You’re a great fit if:


 * You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
 * You’re eager to grow and develop your technical skills
 * You enjoy digging into numbers and uncovering stories within data
 * You approach challenges with curiosity and enthusiasm
   
   

Why Join Us?


 * Competitive pay: We offer great salaries and bonuses
 * Thriving in Hyper-Growth: Immerse yourself in the dynamic environment of a hyper-growth startup, where you'll encounter daily challenges and avenues for professional advancement
 * Cutting-Edge Collaboration: Engage with innovative technology and join a fast-paced team known for its forward-thinking approach and commitment to innovation
 * Positive Workplace Culture: Experience a professional yet enjoyable atmosphere, where hard work is valued alongside a sense of humor and camaraderie, fostering a fulfilling work environment
   
   

About Benjamin

Benjamin is reshaping the future of cash rewards with a simple idea: everyday actions should earn you cash. Whether you’re making a purchase, playing a mobile game, or watching an ad, you get rewarded with Benjamin Money Moments. It’s that simple.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst and Research Associate

description:
Position Summary: We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Business Data Analyst to join our team. As a Business Data Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting and contributing to business analytics projects and processes. Your work will provide data-driven insights used to advise and develop strategies for operational improvements and future initiatives.




Key Roles / Responsibilities:

• Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to identify business needs and requirements related to data analysis and reporting.

• Utilize statistical methods, modeling, and analytical methodologies to develop and deploy tools, including dashboards, infographics, reports, and models.

• Mine, process, and analyze internal and external data using key performance indicators (KPIs), business results, industry sources, competitor intelligence, and customer information.

• Collect and analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

• Create custom reports and dashboards using Power BI, providing key performance indicators and metrics to inform decision-making.

• Develop and maintain data models, data dictionaries, and data visualization standards.

• Identify and recommend improvements to data collection and analysis processes to enhance data quality and accuracy.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and consistency across different systems and platforms.

• Communicate complex data insights and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

• Stay up to date with emerging trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting.




Required Education, Experience, and Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field.

• Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and reporting.

• Proven experience in data mining techniques such as classification, association, tracking patterns, outlier detection, and clustering.

• Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

• Strong knowledge of Power BI.

• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

• Strong knowledge of SQL and other data analysis tools is preferred.

• Experience working with large and complex data sets, including data modeling and data visualization.

• Ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders.

• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

• Excellent organizational and time management skills.

• Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.




Working Conditions:

• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

• Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

• Positions self to install equipment, including under desks.

• Moves throughout the building to access files.

• Must be able to comprehend and follow written and oral instructions.

• Must be able to complete tasks even with frequent interruptions.

• Must be able to use discretion and independent judgment as needed.

• Must be able to speak clearly on the phone and to fellow workers.




This job description should not be interpreted as an exhaustive list of responsibilities or as an employment agreement between the employer and the employee. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification and are subject to change as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change. Any essential functions of this position will be evaluated as necessary should an employee/applicant be unable to perform the functions or requirements due to a disability as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Reasonable accommodation for the specific disability will be made for the employee/applicant when possible.

description:
Job Title: Consumer Insight Analyst II

Reports to: Senior Marketing Manager, SHEIN X

Job Location: Los Angeles, CA, USA

Job Status: Exempt







About SHEIN

SHEIN Distribution Corporation distributes SHEIN's products in the U.S. Founded in 2012, SHEIN is a leading global online retailer with operations in Guangzhou, Singapore and Los Angeles, along with other key markets. SHEIN reaches consumers across more than 150 countries and regions around the world. We place a premium on choice, delivering more than 6,000 new fashion, beauty and lifestyle products daily with more than 600,000 items available. Our mission is to help people express their individuality through the latest trends that are accessible and affordable. To learn more about SHEIN, follow us @us.shein.com,sheingroup.com, Instagram.com/sheinofficial, Instagram.com/shein_us, youtube.com/shein.




Position Summary

Our Senior Specialist will be responsible for the trend forecasting and product development at SHEIN X. The candidate will report to the Senior Marketing Manager in a fast-paced working environment. Our ideal candidate will be adept at using data to identify upcoming fashion trends, collaborating with designers, and creating strateiges that drive the success of our collection. Your data-driven insights will inform collection themes, product designs, and seasonal strategies to ensure our collection resonate with customers and achieve sales targets.




You’re not only analytical, but also a fashion insider who is goal oriented, passionate to work with creators, and a team player. Who we’re looking for: a forward-thinking, hardworking, diligent, self-starting individual with the mindset that this is more than just a job, this is your career. You wear many hats, chase after your dreams, and are comfortable with picking up the slack wherever needed. You’ll be able to bring your groundbreaking ideas to SHEIN.




Job Responsibilities

 * Trend Forecasting & Collection Theme Development
 * Analyze fashion trends, consumer behavior, and market data to forecast upcoming apparel collection themes.
 * Use industry reports, social media trends, and cultural insights to predict key color palettes, silhouettes, and styles for the upcoming seasons.
 * Identify and evaluate potential designers to collaborate with, based on their design aesthetic, portfolio, and alignment with brand vision.
 * Product Development Planning
 * Work with cross-functional teams to create a comprehensive product development plan, ensuring alignment between design, production, and merchandising.
 * Develop detailed seasonal briefs and provide key product insights to guide the design process, balancing creativity with data-driven insights.
 * Monitor product development timelines and ensure timely delivery of collections to meet market demands.
 * Data Analysis & Performance Recaps
 * Analyze sales performance, consumer feedback, and market data to evaluate which products performed well and which did not.
 * Create actionable reports and presentations summarizing the performance of past collections, providing insights and recommendations for future collections.
 * Utilize data analysis tools to track trends, spot emerging opportunities, and refine merchandising strategies.
 * Collaboration with Designers & Cross-Functional Teams
 * Work closely with designers to ensure alignment between trend forecasts and the final product designs.
 * Provide input and feedback to designers throughout the product development process, helping to shape designs that resonate with our target audience and meet sales objectives.
 * Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to ensure the products align with the overall brand messaging and marketing campaigns.




Job Requirements

 * Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Fashion, Fashion Merchandising, Business, Data Analytics, or related field is preferred.
 * Minimum 3-5 years of experience in fashion and/or fashion merchandising, trend forecasting, or product development within the fashion industry is preferred.
 * Strong analytical skills with experience using data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, or similar) to drive decision-making.
 * Proven ability to forecast trends and create successful merchandising strategies that meet sales and customer needs.
 * Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with designers, cross-functional teams, and senior leadership.
 * A keen eye for fashion trends, strong understanding of the fashion lifecycle, and a deep passion for the industry.




Pay

$67,200.00 min. - $86,400.00 max annually. Bonus offered.




Benefits and Perks

 * Healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription drugs)
 * Health Savings Account with Employer Funding
 * Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare and Dependent care)
 * Company-Paid Basic Life/AD&D insurance
 * Company-Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
 * Voluntary Benefit Offerings (Voluntary Life/AD&D, Hospital Indemnity, Critical Illness, and Accident)
 * Employee Assistance Program
 * Business Travel Accident Insurance
 * 401(k) Savings Plan with discretionary company match and access to a financial advisor
 * Vacation, paid holidays, floating holiday and sick days
 * Employee discounts
 * Free weekly catered lunch
 * Dog-friendly office (available at select locations)
 * Free gym access (available at select locations)
 * Free swag giveaways
 * Annual Holiday Party
 * Invitations to pop-ups and other company events
 * Complimentary daily office snacks and beverages




SHEIN Distribution is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workplace environment.
title: Consumer Insight Analyst

description:
Data Ideology

At DI, we provide Data & Analytics expertise to drive measurable business outcomes, often solving complex business problems for our clients. Our data analytics advisory services enable our customers to transform data into insights by driving a culture of empowerment and ownership of results. Our team consists of highly motivated individuals passionate about learning, understanding, collaborating, and intellectually curious. For more information about Data Ideology, visit www.dataideology.com

Sr. Data Analyst - Full-time

We are looking for Data Analytics Consultants to join our growing team. A Data Analytics Consultant will leverage their business and technical knowledge to organize and manage deliverables in a data warehouse consolidation and business intelligence implementation project, while also working with business and technical teams to understand business strategy and objectives, gather information, and ensure business requirements are being fulfilled throughout the entire data & analytics lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities


 * Data Analysis and Interpretation:
    * Conduct in-depth analysis using the data warehouse to identify trends, patterns, and insights
    * Interpret complex data sets and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

 * Data Extraction and Transformation:
    * Assist with ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources
    * Collaborate with IT teams to create seamless data integrations

 * Quality Assurance and Testing
    * Perform thorough data validation and testing to ensure the highest possible data quality
    * Clearly define and communicate when quality standards are not being met

 * Problem Solving
    * Perform root cause analysis to identify the underlying or fundamental causes of an issue or problem
    * Demonstrate ability to offer suggestions and solutions to remedy issues and promote sustainability

 * Collaboration and Communication:
    * Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT and business stakeholders, to align on goals and key deliverables
    * Effectively prioritize tasks to meet established team goals

 * Documentation:
    * Accurately document data mappings and definitions
    * Outline standard processes and procedures of core activities
      

Qualifications

Education and Experience:


 * Bachelor’s degree in healthcare or computer science related field preferred, but not necessary
 * 5+ years’ experience with any programming language (SQL, PLSQL, R, Python, etc)
 * 5+ years’ experience in data analytics on any data warehouse (Oracle, SQL, Snowflake)
 * Healthcare experience a plus
 * Consulting experience a plus
 * Agile/SAFe experience a plus
   
   

Work Environment:


 * Remote work from home
 * Hours of work and days are generally Monday through Friday. Specific business hours will depend on client needs
   
   

Physical Demands:


 * Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time
 * The person in this position must occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, library stacks, office machinery, etc
 * Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and printer
 * The person in this position frequently communicates with clients and coworkers. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations
   
   

Benefits:


 * FlexibleTime Off Policy
 * Insurance (medical, dental, vision) for employees
 * 100% company paid - short and long-term disability insurance for employees
 * 100% company paid - life insurance and AD&D insurance for employees
 * 100% company paid – employee assistance program
 * Retirement plans with company match
 * Training and Certification Reimbursement annually
 * Utilization based bonus
 * Commission incentive program
 * Profit Sharing Plan
 * Referral Bonuses
   
   

Data Ideology is an EEO Employer

description:
Tagup is passionate about providing our customers with technical solutions that satisfy their business needs. Through collaborative interactions with customers, team members, subject matter experts (SMEs), technical leaders, and partners we design practical solutions that solve real problems for major government and business organizations.

The BI Analyst will be responsible for identifying and reviewing new business opportunities, researching client markets, competitors, assessing RFIs, RFPs, contracts, budgets and trends to assist the Business Development organization in making sound business decisions. This role works directly for the Business Intelligence Group Manager and in close collaboration with executive management and Capture Managers. The BI analyst will maintain the accuracy of the pipeline and provide real-time reporting and forecasting to senior leadership.

Responsibilities


 * Lead development, research, and identification of relevant opportunity-specific information across all phases of the capture process
 * Perform market research to qualify new business opportunities, including analysis of customers, capability gaps, budgets, incumbent intel, competitors, contract types, and workforce
 * Assist Capture Managers in all phases of capture as required
 * Responsible for posting and evaluating new contracts (IDIQ & GWAC) opportunities and developing action plans for response
 * Manage and maintain pipeline using CRM tool, ensuring accuracy and reporting on a weekly basis
 * Research and identify new opportunities using industry GovCon databases and tools to maintain a healthy and robust pipeline
 * Produces metrics, and forecasting briefs as required
 * Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis
 * Ability to work across multiple organizations to build and maintain strong partnerships in support of new capture activities
 * Research and analyzes industry market trends for long-term planning
 * Provide assistance and backup to Proposal Group as required
   
   
   
   
   

Required Skills And Experience


 * 1-3 years of experience with pipeline management and Business Intelligence research for federal government contracts
 * Experience with using CRM tool
 * Strong analytical skills
 * Proposal management experience
 * Strong communication and organizational skills
 * Ability to reach across cross-functional aisles and the various capability groups across the organization in order to drive growth
 * Advanced skills in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Adobe Acrobat
   
   
   
   
   

Preferred Skills and Experience:


 * Experience with both civilian and DoD Government agencies
   
   
   
   
   

This job posting sets forth the authorities and responsibilities of this position, which may be changed from time to time as shall be determined.

Tagup is an equal opportunity employer and individuals seeking employment with us are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

We provide a competitive salary and benefits package that reflects experience and qualifications. Our commitment is to attract and retain top talent, and we believe in fairly compensating our employees for their contributions. As a fast-growing technology company, we offer all team members part-ownership through an Employee Stock Option Plan. Additionally, we provide health insurance benefits, access to a company 401(k) plan, and foster a team-oriented work environment with regular company outings.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
FULL-TIME JOB VACANCY

DATA AND DIGITAL ANALYST

Development and Outreach Department

Multiple Locations Considered

Application Deadline: January 2, 2025




The Data and Digital Analyst, within the Fundraising Data & Analysis team, is responsible for enabling a data-driven and data-informed culture to make evidence-based decisions as well as support on our Digital Product Infrastructure.

The post holder will work across the Digital Systems, ensuring effective administration and training is provided to the platform users, including developing robust onboarding and offboarding processes; along with monitoring our synchronizations between systems and conducting reconciliation as needed.

The post holder will generate, improve and analyze fundraising data, both quantitative and qualitative, from internal and external sources to produce strategic information that supports data-driven and informed decisions, tactics, and strategies that consistently maximize HRW fundraising results.

The post holder will also provide, with supervision from the Data Analyst Lead, ad-hoc analysis, data selections, reporting and develop the reporting and documentation required to support the end users; with support from the Training and Support team. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Analytics and Insight, on the FSDA team and may be based in any of the following HRW Offices: Chicago, New York, Washington DC, Sao Paulo, London, Brussels, Amsterdam, Berlin, Amman, Nairobi, Tunis, Toronto or Johannesburg.




Responsibilities:

System Administration, Processes and Training

 * Onboarding and Offboarding users to our key digital technology tools, including Engaging Networks, Stripe, PayPal, Worldpay (formerly Vantiv) iQ.
 * Permission Management of users across Marketing Cloud, in addition to routine review of product usage to enable licenses to be recycled.
 * Processing Invoices for our digital tools are required, liaising with IT, Finance and the MD of Fundraising Systems and Data Analytics on changes to levels of expenditure.
 * Working with the Training & Support team in creating Training Programs for the Digital Tools, ensuring guidance is routinely updated and sessions conducted with Staff across development; this would include a hybrid of written documentation and videos.
 * Assessing Feasibility on external courses that would be applicable for FSDA staff or wider Development colleagues, in addition to putting together suggested trailheads for users of the Marketing Cloud system.
 * Contribute to improvement projects that shape the department’s effectiveness, efficiency and data-driven decision making.
 * Develop documentation and assess business requirements for the end-users of reporting and Business intelligence tools, working with the Training & Support team as needed.
 * Work with Data Quality & Integrations Analyst to identify and resolve large-scale data quality issues in reporting data.
 * Work closely with the Revenue Operations team to ensure revenue data quality is accurate and supports long-term reporting for forecasting and revenue projections.




Digital Tool Support:

 * Creating exports across the Engaging Networks and Marketing Cloud systems, additionally ensuring that pages are mapped correctly from Engaging Networks to Salesforce.
 * Build / Review page templates, provide them to 3rd parties for relevant actions, lead form testing, ensuring that key deadlines are adhered to for fundraising activities such as the Voices for Justice Dinners.
 * Working with the Digital Products Owner on Digital improvement projects across the department.




Reconciliation and Hygiene:

 * Monitoring our daily donation syncs between the Engaging Networks and Salesforce Instances, reporting on value discrepancies and correcting data as needed; performing manual cleanups as needed.
 * Adhering to the bi-monthly reconciliation deadlines we have within Development which would involve (But not limited to) the following reconciliations:
 * Reconcile USD Salesforce transactions against Worldpay (formerly Vantiv) and the US Citibank account
 * Reconcile USD Salesforce transactions against PayPal accounts and the US Citibank account
 * Reconcile USD Salesforce transactions against Stripe and the US Citibank account
 * Monitor transactions from Engaging Networks Integration and Marketing Cloud Integration to discern where “dirty data” or fake data is originating and clean it up as needed.




Data, Analysis and Reporting

 * Creating reports to develop and present actionable insights, business intelligence from analytical output, supporting a data driven culture in development the Salesforce, Engaging Networks and Marketing Cloud tools.
 * Contribute to the data and insight strategy including activity reporting, financial forecasting, specialist report development and ad hoc analysis projects and data selections, to increase understanding of activity, supporter and financial trends and making recommendations to leadership to deliver improvements.
 * Collaborate with the Marketing Team to create data selections including recommendations on which are the best targets for direct marketing campaigns, create segments according to strategically determined criteria, data modelling, and develop testing plans to yield statistically significant results.
 * Work with the Data Analyst Lead to build tools and reports that underpin Business as Usual activity; triaging Tier 1 queries and reporting discrepancies with the current reporting.
 * Provide support as needed to the Fundraising teams on any areas of Data, Selections, Reporting and Analysis; working with the Data Analyst Lead to understand business prioritization requirements.
 * Ensuring that the Marketing coding / attribution processes are clearly documented and any exceptions tracked with the Revenue Operations teams.




Other:

 1. Carry out other duties as required.




Qualifications:

Education: A bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience is required.

Experience: Minimum of two years of relevant experience working in fundraising data analysis or business data analysis is required. Knowledge and experience in nonprofit fundraising and marketing, preferably in a global INGO context with country-specific fundraising operations, is highly desirable.




Related Skills and Knowledge:

1. Fluency in fundraising practices, terminology, technologies, channels, and compliance, and the ability to translate easily between fundraising end users and technology providers.

2. Excellent analytical skills and the ability to interpret and present complex data.

3. Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.

4. Fluency in SQL or similar database query language desired.

5. Proficiency in using Engaging Networks, or another e-CRM, is essential.

6. Proficiency in using E-Mail Applications such as Mailchimp is essential, with Marketing Cloud knowledge a plus.

7. Proficiency in using fundraising software platforms, CRM systems (Salesforce Desirable), and building data analytics tools and reports using BI tools like Power BI or Tableau is also desirable.

8. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical staff.

9. Ability to work collaboratively and build trust with diverse stakeholders from around the globe, including staff for whom English is not their first language.

10. Detail-oriented with excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.

11. Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders and teams.

12. Strong project management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities.

13. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office software, particularly Excel.




Salary and Benefits: HRW seeks exceptional applicants and offers competitive compensation and employer-paid benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance. Candidates must possess valid work authorization for the location in which they'd like to be based. The salary range for this position if based in the US is 62,060 - 66,387. Salary ranges outside of the US vary based on location.

Candidates must possess valid work authorization for the location in which they would like to be based.




How to Apply: Please apply by January 2, 2025, by visiting our online job portal at careers.hrw.org and attaching a cover letter and resume, preferably in PDF format. No calls or email inquiries, please. Only complete applications will be reviewed, and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.




If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application submission or require a disability related accommodation, please email recruitment@hrw.org. Due to the large response, application submissions via email will not be accepted and inquiries regarding the status of applications will go unanswered.




Human Rights Watch is strong because it is diverse. We actively seek a diverse applicant pool and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Human Rights Watch does not discriminate on the basis of disability, age, gender identity and expression, national origin, race and ethnicity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, or criminal record. We welcome all kinds of diversity. Our employees include people who are parents and nonparents, the self-taught and university educated, and from a wide span of socio- economic backgrounds and perspectives on the world. Human Rights Watch is an equal opportunity employer.

Human Rights Watch is an international human rights monitoring and advocacy organization known for its in-depth investigations, its incisive and timely reporting, its innovative and high- profile advocacy campaigns, and its success in changing the human rights-related policies and practices of influential governments and international institutions.
title: Data and Digital Analyst

description:
Business & Data Analyst




The Business & Data Analyst is responsible for identifying data elements in IT delivery systems and processes to assist with gathering requirements for developing business intelligence reports, performing data analysis by developing and executing SQL queries, maintaining data dictionaries for changes in data fields and their use, and identifying IT data enhancement releases and updates that impact Aqua business intelligence reports.




Essential Functions

 * Independently works and communicates with all levels of management and across multiple product lines to determine reporting/project requirements and to research/resolve technical issues with reporting tools and functionality.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to identify, gather, and document business requirements for reporting deliverables, and processes
 * Document business and data requirements, functional reporting specifications, use cases, and process flows to communicate effectively with stakeholders and Reporting development teams to ensure accurate dashboards and reports are created and developed by business intelligence reporting teams
 * Utilizing data analysis techniques and tools analyze gathered data requirements to identify patterns, trends, and inconsistencies, ensuring that they align with business goals and objectives
 * Manage the Data Dictionary for Snowflake, including updating it with new fields as they are introduced from system projects.
 * Identify business problems, challenges, and opportunities through data analysis in Snowflake and document, report in Jira tickets to propose innovative solutions or process improvements to address them
 * Data Analysis: Collect, structure, interpret, and extract complex data into actionable insights through the use of their SQL skills




Required Education and Experience

 * Bachelor’s degree in Business or technical discipline, or commensurate work experience, required
 * 3 years of Data Analysis, or related work experience, required
 * Ability to use SQL skills to extract data from system application data tables
 * Knowledge of Snowflake is a preferred
 * Experience with SQL required
 * Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)
 * Proficient in requirements management tools (e.g., JIRA, Share Point)
 * Proficient in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Microsoft Sql Server Management Studio, Datadog, Snowflake)
 * Financial industry experience preferred
 * Occasional travel required for training and/or project work with external stakeholders and project team members may be required
 * Periodic after core hours, night and weekend work is required in relation with essential functions.
 * Attention to detail and accuracy required.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
 * Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment.




Physical Demands




While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, visualize, talk, hear, and handle or touch objects or controls. The employee may occasionally lift, push, or pull up to 20 pounds.




This position is an office-based position where you must be able to sit for long periods of time. The employee will be working on a computer 90% of the time.
title: Business & Data Analyst

description:
Company

Qualcomm Incorporated

Job Area

Miscellaneous Group, Miscellaneous Group > Data Analyst

General Summary

We are seeking an experienced Performance Analytics Analyst with strong expertise in people analytics to join our People Analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering actionable insights, engaging with senior leaders, and applying your technical expertise to enhance our data analytics processes, delivery, and support broader people analytics initiatives. You will play a crucial role in driving strategic decisions and contributing to the overall success of our organization.

Key Responsibilities


 * Data Analysis & Reporting
    * Analyze employee performance data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.
    * Develop and maintain performance dashboards and reports for various stakeholders.
    * Provide deep-dive analyses and insights to support business decisions.
      
      
      
      

 * People Analytics
    * Conduct comprehensive people analytics to understand workforce dynamics, engagement, retention, and other key HR metrics.
    * Develop predictive models and conduct scenario analyses to inform talent strategy.
    * Collaborate with HR to enhance data-driven approaches to talent acquisition, development, and retention.
      
      
      
      

 * Stakeholder Engagement
    * Collaborate with senior leaders to understand their needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.
    * Present findings and recommendations to executive leadership in a clear and compelling manner.
    * Serve as a trusted advisor to HR and business leaders on performance and people analytics matters.
      
      
      
      

 * Technical Expertise
    * Utilize advanced statistical methods and tools to analyze complex data sets.
    * Continuously enhance data collection processes and systems to improve data quality and accessibility.
    * Stay current with industry trends and best practices in performance and people analytics, as well as data science.
      

 * Project Management
    * Lead and manage small to medium sized performance and people analytics projects from inception to completion.
    * Ensure timely delivery of high-quality analytical outputs.
    * Coordinate with cross-functional teams to drive performance and people-related improvement initiatives.
      
      
      

Qualifications


 * Preferred Education & Experience
    * Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Business Analytics, Human Resources, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
    * 4+ years of experience in performance analytics, people analytics, or a similar role.
      
      
      
      

 * Technical Skills
    * Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, R, Python, or similar.
    * Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
    * Strong understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
    * Familiarity with HRIS systems and people analytics platforms.
      
      
      
      

 * Soft Skills
    * Excellent communication and presentation skills.
    * Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
    * Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
    * Proven ability to interact effectively with senior leaders and influence decision-making.
      
      
      

This is an office-based position with possible locations that may include San Diego, CA, Austin, TX, Raleigh, NC, Santa Clara, CA, Boston, MA.

title: Data Analyst, Staff - People Analytics

description:
Company Overview

Cohere Health is a fast-growing clinical intelligence company that’s improving lives at scale by promoting the best patient-specific care options, using leading edge AI combined with deep clinical expertise. In only four years our solutions have been adopted by health insurance plans covering over 15 million people, while our revenues and company size have quadrupled. That growth combined with capital raises totaling $106M positions us extremely well for continued success. Our awards include: 2023 and 2024 BuiltIn Best Place to Work, Top 5 LinkedIn™ Startup, TripleTree iAward, multiple KLAS Research Points of Light, along with recognition on Fierce Healthcare's Fierce 15 and CB Insights' Digital Health 150 lists.

Opportunity Overview

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to come join our awesome team. In this role, you will ensure that data in our platform is validated, cleaned, and ready for any reporting and analytics work. You will work closely with the business intelligence, clinical program, product, and engineering teams to understand data needs, validate ETL summary reports, monitor jobs, and troubleshoot complex issues. The work will be fast-paced and project-based, with evolving needs - requiring scrappiness, flexibility, curiosity, and grace under pressure.

At our growing organization, this position offers the ability to make a substantive mark on the company and its partners with exponential growth opportunities. You will be part of the data management team, building one Cohere data platform to support our downstream teams in optimizing patient care paths.

Last but not least: People who succeed here are empathetic teammates who are candid, kind, caring, and embody our core values and principles. We believe that diverse, inclusive teams make the most impactful work. Cohere is deeply invested in ensuring that we have a supportive, growth-oriented environment that works for everyone.

What You Will Do


 * Be responsible for cohere standard medical saving production data job and governance
 * Quickly understand Cohere’s products, services and clinical programs and how Cohere’s x-functional collaboration and workflow support healthcare providers’ workflow and patients’ care journeys.
 * Partner with key business users and stakeholders to resolve data issues and validate procedures and results.
 * Enhance and maintain a scalable quality check process, ensuring data integrity by identifying and resolving anomalies, missing data, and validation issues.
 * Develop and review ETL summary reports, ensuring accuracy and reliability of data transformations.
 * Coordinate with the engineering team to create automation and efficiencies in production jobs.
 * Build benchmark data source for internal analytics users.
 * Test and validate implementation results with the stakeholders.
 * Create and maintain a comprehensive data issue log to track and manage resolution progress.
 * Quickly understand Cohere’s products, services and clinical programs and how Cohere’s x-functional collaboration and workflow support healthcare providers’ workflow and patients’ care journey
 * Work with business analysts to understand what data we have and monitor production jobs
 * Ensure data quality, for example:
 * Monitor daily refresh data jobs from payer to our Cohere platform and from Cohere platform to our data platform
 * Perform and review quality checks on incoming, outgoing and aggregated data in order to identify data anomalies.
 * Map and specify target data requirements and associated data transformations and validations
   
   

Your Background & Requirements


 * 5+ years data experience at company where health outcomes were critical to the mission, healthcare analytics or a population health organization
 * Passionate about improving the U.S. healthcare system and helping ensure every patient receives the best care possible
 * Self-starter, able to work independently, able to succeed in a fast-paced, high intensity start-up environment
 * Proficient in ETL infra and languages like Spark, PySpark, Python and SQL
 * Extensive experience in deploying and managing ETL pipelines using Apache Airflow
 * GitHub: Experience with version control, branching, and collaboration on GitHub is a must-have
 * Familiarity with AWS suite tools including but not limited to Athena, Sagemaker, Glue, EMR,
 * CloudWatch, etc.
 * Strong analysis and validation skills
 * Strong interest and understanding of EMR data, Claims and SDOH data
 * Excellent interpersonal skills to work with end users to develop metrics
 * Knowledge of STARs, HEDIS and other clinical / financial metrics in healthcare
 * Ability to understand and work with large quantities of data to identify trends, errors and gaps
 * Ability to multi-task and manage concurrent projects in various stages of development
 * Strong Excel and other MS Office tools skills
 * Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Salesforce and Kibana, preferred
 * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in STEM, public health, finance, economics, or other related field
   
   

We can’t wait to learn more about you and meet you at Cohere Health!

Equal Opportunity Statement

Cohere Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all. To us, it’s personal.

The salary range for this position is $90,000 to $120,000 annually; as part of a total benefits package which includes health insurance, 401k and bonus. In accordance with state applicable laws, Cohere is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Individual pay decisions are ultimately based on a number of factors, including but not limited to qualifications for the role, experience level, skillset, and internal alignment.
