description:
About Us:

Building Services 32BJ Benefit Funds (“the Funds”) is the umbrella organization responsible for administering Health, Pension, Retirement Savings, Training, and Legal Services benefits to over 100,000 SEIU 32BJ members. Our mission is to make significant contributions to the lives of our members by providing high quality benefits and services. Through our commitment, we embody five core values: Flexibility, Initiative, Respect, Sustainability, and Teamwork (FIRST). By following our core values, employees are open to different and new ways of doing things, take active steps to improve the organization, create an environment of trust and respect, approach their work with the intent of a positive outcome, and work collaboratively with colleagues.

For 2023 and beyond, 32BJ Benefit Fundswill continue to drive innovation, equity, and technology insights to further help the lives of our hard-working members and their families. We use cutting edge technology such as: M365, Dynamics 365 CRM, Dynamics 365 F&O, Azure, AWS, SQL, Snowflake, QlikView, and more. Through this technology investment, we have gathered and analyzed thousands of data insights to influence health insurance legislation and propose new health policy. Our efforts have galvanized many leaders and the consensus is there is plenty more work to be done.

Please take a moment to watch our video to learn more about our culture and contributions to our members: youtu.be/hYNdMGLn19A

Summary: 32BJ Health Fund is looking for a Health Data Analyst that will play a crucial role in analyzing complex data sets to help inform business decisions and drive strategic initiatives. You will work closely with various departments to identify trends, create reports, and provide actionable insights primarily related to claims data. You will needs to be passionate about working with structured and unstructured data, be flexible in dealing with ambiguity and be comfortable analyzing and solving discrepancies.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


 * Support the Health Fund’s commitment and mission of improving lives of 32BJ members.
 * Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support business decision-making.
 * Use statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data sets.
 * Create and present reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams within the health fund, vendors and partners to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
 * Investigate performance of Fund’s vendors and partners to improve patient care.
 * Design and implement data collection processes and tools.
 * Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
   
   
   

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required


 * At least one (1) year of work experience programming using healthcare claims, or healthcare industry data sources.
 * Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, QlikView)
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and comfortable working with unstructured data.
 * Strong writing and presentation skills with the ability to express analysis in simple to understand language and visuals.
   
   
   

Interpersonal Skills:


 * Detail oriented with excellent organizational and analytical skills
 * Curious to understand and pursue outlying data points and to clarify opaque findings
 * Eager to find insights in the data and to effectively share findings
 * Highly communicative and collaborative – must love working in a team environment
 * Ability seek support when needed, communicate timelines and meet deadlines
   
   
   

Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Language Skills: Fluent in English

Reasoning Ability: High

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: None

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.


 * Under 1/3 of the time: Standing, Walking, Climbing or Balancing, Stooping, Kneeling, Crouching, or Crawling
 * 1/2 to 2/3 of the time: Sitting, Reaching with Hands & Arms
 * Over 2/3 of the time: Talking or Hearing
 * 100% of the time: Using Hands
   
   
   

Salary Range:

$95000.00 To 105000.00 (USD) Annually
title: Health Data Analyst

description:
Dandy is transforming the massive ($200B) but antiquated dental industry. Backed by some of the world's leading venture capital investors, we are on an ambitious mission to integrate and simplify every function of the dental practice through technology. By building the operating system for every dental office in America, Dandy is empowering dentists with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practice, their people, and their patients.

Revolutionizing the dental industry is hard…and we need help.

We are looking for resourceful senior data analysts to own some of our highest-impact problems in our revenue analytics space. Our revenue team is responsible for key aspects of Dandy’s business, and this role will support the post-sale team on growing recurring revenue, improving customer retention, and increasing customer lifetime value. This role will enable the post-sale team to introduce our current customers to additional product lines and drive customer ordering behavior through an increased understanding of customers by segment. In this highly cross-functional role, you will work autonomously to leverage data analysis in order to make recommendations that make Dandy a more compelling service for our customers.

Your Responsibilities/opportunities


 * Develop and share insights that drive the revenue team and partner functions, such as operations and product, to better serve and retain our customers
 * Define the data language (i.e. KPIs, dashboards, measurement, etc) to ensure your team grasps the underlying truth that drives progress and success
 * Facilitate rapid decision making through ad hoc work or by democratizing data/self service (effective BI or user-friendly explores in Looker in partnership with our data engineers)
 * Design and execute effective A/B experiments that cater our product offering to our customer’s needs and boost recurring revenue
 * Utilize your data super powers to reduce ambiguity and solve problems
 * Be a strategic thought partner with cross-functional stakeholders
 * Mentor other analysts and help them grow
   
   

About you:


 * 6+ years of experience working in revenue, retention, and customer life cycle analytics, ideally in a B2B setting
 * BA/BS in behavioral science (economics, psychology, etc) with statistics skills or a BA/BS in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, engineering, or natural sciences with customer empathy (or equivalent experience)
 * Excellent skills in SQL and Python
 * Strong communication skills and experience communicating results in a way that drives change. You have the ability to use data to inform, align, and lead
 * Strong senses of autonomy and ownership
 * Strong critical thinking, problem solving, and statistical skills
   
   

Bonus points:


 * Experience working with revenue data at a company like Shopify, Amazon, Uber, Lyft, Instacart, or the like.
 * Interest in working and learning in an earlier stage company where we’re still working out some of the basics
 * Strong customer empathy, particularly for dentists
 * Experience in Looker, Hex, and DBT
   
   

The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Dandy is $165,000-$182,000 plus equity. Actual compensation is based on a number of factors including, but not limited to the primary work location, candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience.

J-368

For full time positions, we offer a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits including healthcare, dental, parental planning, mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will move at Dandy speed and do everything in our power to meet your needs.
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
Job Details

Description

At INTRUST Bank, principles and performance go hand in hand. We hire for character and commitment because we believe a focus on values contributes to a healthy and positive culture where employees are celebrated for their individual potential, unique talents are further developed, and positive relationships are fostered. This philosophy has guided us for more than 145 years, and the tradition continues today.

As an INTRUST employee, you become part of a tradition shared with five generations of family leadership. A tradition focused on the success and well-being of our customers, employees, shareholders, and the communities we call home, and a commitment to being a company of character in all that we do.

Our employees are the heart of our company and a large part of why customers continue to trust INTRUST. We want to make sure you succeed, so your priorities are our priority. Here, you can grow and lead no matter your title.

A modern benefits approach: To support our employees and their families, INTRUST offers a comprehensive, market-competitive benefits package that prioritizes your total well-being.


 * Competitive pay
 * Generous time off
    * Employees receive three weeks of paid vacation plus 11 paid holidays each year
    * Paid time off to volunteer in the community
    * Paid employee and family sick leave – two weeks upon hire with monthly accruals

 * 401(k) plan with 6% employer match and 100% immediately vested
    * 3% non-elective company contribution; non-elective contribution vested after 3 years of service

 * Career growth and development resources
 * Tuition reimbursement for full-time and part-time employees enrolled in any degree program
 * Banking benefits
    * Interest-bearing employee checking and savings accounts
    * Discounted rates on auto loans, home equity loans, and unsecured loans

 * Medical, dental, and vision insurance
    * Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution if enrolled in the high deductible health plan
    * Flexible Spending Account (FSA), participation in an INTRUST insurance plan is not required

 * Basic life and AD&D coverage provided at no cost to the employees working 29+ hours a week
 * Long-term disability coverage provided at no cost to employees working 37.5+ hours a week
 * Voluntary critical illness coverage available
 * Confidential access to professional counselors to assist with a wide variety of situations
   

Benefits eligibility is dependent upon hire date and employment status. Ask for our benefits guide for full details.

Job Summary: Responsible for developing and providing consultation for reports requested by all areas of the company. Collaborates with internal stakeholders to determine reporting requirements. Implements process changes to improve efficiency and increase automation in other areas. Learns new software, systems, and workflow processes, as necessary. Runs and prepares recurring reports that require analysis of information and/or manual intervention before distributing to end users. Updates procedures and documentation as it relates to putting reports into production or preparing recurring reports. Promotes an environment of teamwork within the department and across the bank. Represents INTRUST Bank in all they do in the community and is focused on the development of new business relationships. Must maintain strict standards of confidentiality and perform duties in a manner supporting INTRUST’s character qualities.

Essential Functions


 * All expectations described in the job description’s essential functions are necessary to be successful in this role, performed with or without a reasonable accommodation.
 * Works with internal customers to understand business information needs and reporting requirements. Must be resourceful in figuring out how to meet customer needs and have good communication skills to gain an understanding of a request and to communicate results.
 * Provides accurate, timely information to all levels of management of the company with a high level of accountability.
 * Has the ability to learn new systems and processes, often on his/her own, to gain understanding of requests being made.
 * Improves processes in other departments by finding ways to automate their work and reduce manual intervention.
 * Uses judgment and knowledge to identify and question inaccurate information. Ensures that information disseminated to the team and end users is accurate and recognizes, researches, resolves, and corrects inaccurate information in a short time frame.
 * Utilizes multiple systems, make decisions on projects that have a wide impact, and follows up with appropriate personnel.
 * Works independently and within a team effectively using the most efficient process and tools.
 * Works with all levels of management and employee base, and systems, as well as internal and external auditors, regulators, and third-party software vendors.
 * Must be results-driven with the ability to take initiatives and meet deadlines in a fast-paced changing environment.
 * Performs a variety of tasks and must be organized with the ability to multi-task.
   
   

Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in Accounting, Data Analytics, Finance or Management Information Systems required. Related work experience with knowledge of query tools is a plus.

Location: Onsite in Wichita, KS

Required Skills and Knowledge: Must have good researching and analytical skills, along with advanced computer skills. Experience in some or all of the following areas: Tableau, Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access), Monarch, Business Objects, SQL, and Bank accounting methods.

Required Licenses and/or Certifications: None.

Physical Demands: Extended period(s) of time may be spent viewing a personal computer, sitting, standing, and walking. Occasional lifting up to 25 lbs. The physical demands necessary for this role should be performed with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Working Conditions: Normal office conditions.

This job description summary is not intended to be an employment contract, nor is it intended to state or imply these are the only activities to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other duties as assigned or requested by their supervisor.

INTRUST Financial Corporation and its subsidiaries, including INTRUST Bank, are Equal Opportunity Employers whose policy is not to discriminate unlawfully against any qualified employee or applicant for employment on the basis of protected military or veteran status, disability, race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal law; except where an individual’s protected category constitutes a bona fide occupational qualification.
title: Data Analyst - Reporting

description:
The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting various datasets to enable insights and initiatives to drive business growth, improve customer retention, inform strategic decisions, and grant valuable insights to various stakeholders who support the Government sales channel inside Thomson Reuters.

The successful candidate must be agile and responsive to the dynamic Government market and evolving internal processes, tools, and commercial strategies. This individual should be well organized, creative, a strategic thinker, and have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

About the Role:


 * Streamlining data collection methods to create automated and easy-to-use dashboards and reports – important data points include sales and retention analysis, customer behavior metrics, and commercial analysis.
 * Maintaining data systems by addressing errors and monitoring performance, specifically around customer data
 * Analyzing collected data and putting it into a format that others can easily interpret
 * Interpreting data trends and patterns as they relate to the organization
 * Preparing reports for organizational leadership to use in a business setting
 * Improve customer tagging and segmentation to enhance analysis and reporting
 * Collaborating with others to determine areas of improvement in relation to data
 * Develop an understanding of business partner needs, current state and develop designs for future state
   
   
   

About You:

Background


 * 2+ years of experience as a Customer Data Analyst or equivalent experience in data or business analytics
 * Bachelor’s degree: Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Analytics, Finance, or related field is preferred
   
   
   

Skills


 * Analytical: Interprets data to identify customer behavior and preferences.
 * Data Visualization: Creates interactive and static visualizations to convey complex insights.
 * Technical Aptitude: Quickly learns and applies new technologies.
 * Project Management: Manages multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery.
 * Solution-oriented: Develops and implements effective solutions to problems.
 * Reliable: Meets deadlines and maintains quality under pressure.
 * Flexible: Adapts to changing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
 * Strong Communication: Influences and persuades colleagues, customers, and stakeholders through effective communication.
 * Self-starter: Takes ownership of projects, resolving problems independently.
   
   
   

Tool / System Experience


 * Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and MS Teams.
 * Strong experience with data analysis tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, and Alteryx
 * Familiarity with the following technologies is beneficial: Python, SQL, SAP, and Business Objects
   
   
   

What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:


 * Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected
 * Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
 * Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
 * Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
 * Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
 * Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
   
   
   

In the United States, Thomson Reuters offers a comprehensive benefits package to our employees. Our benefit package includes market competitive health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance programs, as well as a competitive 401k plan with company match. In addition, Thomson Reuters offers market leading work life benefits with competitive vacation, sick and safe paid time off, paid holidays (including two company mental health days off), parental leave, sabbatical leave. These benefits meet or exceeds the requirements of paid time off in accordance with any applicable state or municipal laws. Finally, Thomson Reuters offers the following additional benefits: optional hospital, accident and sickness insurance paid 100% by the employee; optional life and AD&D insurance paid 100% by the employee; Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts; fitness reimbursement; access to Employee Assistance Program; Group Legal Identity Theft Protection benefit paid 100% by employee; access to 529 Plan; commuter benefits; Adoption & Surrogacy Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement; and access to Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The base compensation range varies across locations. Eligible office location(s) for this role include one or more of the following: New York City, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and/or Irvine, CA; McLean, VA; Washington, DC. The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $81,600 - $151,600. Eagan, MN; Ann Arbor, MI; Richmond, VA; Rochester, NY. The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $70,500 - $130,900. Chicago, IL; Frisco, TX; Houston, TX; fully remote location. For these locations and any eligible US locations not otherwise noted, including for fully remote location if applicable, the base compensation range for this role is $74,200 - $137,800. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance. Base pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay is one part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

Financial Crimes Data Analyst

description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst who is alert, curious, responsive, and resourceful, with a passion for delivering actionable insights and maintaining high standards of data integrity. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in PostgreSQL and MS SQL, complemented by skills in creating visually intuitive and easy-to-navigate dashboards using the Sigma Computing analytics platform. Familiarity with healthcare data, billing processes, and reimbursement systems is highly desirable. Enjoys meeting with and solving customer data requirements.

Primary Functions

The Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, relevance, and accessibility of data across the organization. This role involves monitoring and maintaining dashboards and reports, leveraging analytics tools like Sigma Computing to provide actionable insights. The Data Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to quickly respond to data requests, identify new datasets, and streamline reporting processes, all while maintaining data integrity and governance. This role plays a key part in driving data-driven decision-making and operational efficiency across the company.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities


 * Monitor data trends to ensure dashboards and reports are accurate, up-to-date, and actionable for operational teams.
 * Continuously explore the company’s data landscape, uncovering new insights and identifying the most relevant datasets to address business challenges.
 * Respond promptly to requests for new reports or data insights, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver timely and useful information.
 * Leverage Sigma Computing and other analytics tools effectively to create cost-conscious, impactful dashboards and reports.
 * Streamline the report-building process to reduce turnaround time, enabling teams to make data-driven decisions more quickly.
 * Design intuitive, user-friendly dashboards that allow non-technical users to easily navigate and interpret data.
 * Innovate and scale analytics capabilities by integrating additional data sources and developing complex visualizations to meet growing operational needs.
 * Ensure data integrity by maintaining accurate, reliable, and governed data across all reporting and analytics.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders from various departments to understand their data needs and deliver tailored reports and dashboards.
 * Serve as the primary expert on Sigma Computing, providing support and insights to ensure teams have the necessary tools to operate efficiently.
 * Utilize analytics tools effectively to minimize unnecessary costs while maximizing outcomes and operational efficiency.
 * Other job-related duties as assigned
   
   

Education And Experience


 * Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
 * At least 3 years of experience working with data analysis and database management, specifically with Snowflake, PostgreSQL, and MS SQL.
 * Proven experience in data governance, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
 * Strong experience in creating data visualizations using Sigma, Tableau, or similar tools, with a focus on user-friendly and visually effective dashboards.
 * Knowledge of healthcare data structures, terminology, and billing/reimbursement processes is highly preferred.
   
   

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


 * Strong proficiency in Snowflake, PostgreSQL, and MS SQL.
 * Excellent attention to detail and data accuracy.
 * Customer service-oriented approach with excellent communication skills.
 * Familiarity with UI/UX principles for data visualization.
 * Expertise in Sigma or Tableau, with the ability to design user-friendly and visually appealing customer-facing dashboards.
 * Collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams and departments.
   
   

JOB LOCATION - This role is remote within the state of Texas only, with our corporate office located in Terrell, TX.

Emergicon LLC requires satisfactory pre-employment drug screens and background checks for all positions.

title: Data Analyst-VA

description:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.




Job Overview:

As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.
 * Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.
 * Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
 * Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
 * Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.
 * Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.




Qualifications:

 * Master’s degree.
 * Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
 * Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.

description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Plano, Texas 75024

Duration: 12 Months Contract

Job Description:

Client is looking for:


 * The primary focus of our Analytics teams is to generate actionable insights by leveraging data and using effective data storytelling to help our company make better data-driven decisions
   
   

Candidate will be doing:


 * Uncover business needs and the true questions that the company is trying to answer in order to properly frame your analysis
 * Leverage your SQL/Python coding skills to pull and organize data that is needed for your analysis
 * Assess the quantitative and qualitative impacts of possible actions based on your insight, taking into consideration our customers, our employees, and our company
 * Recommend actions based on your insights by effectively telling the story that is supported by data through presentations (PowerPoint), data visualizations (Tableau), and clear and concise verbal and written communications skills
 * Coordinate with various stakeholders to help implement and measure recommended actions
   
   

Requirements:

Qualifications/ What you bring (Must Haves) – Highlight Top 3 to 5 skills:


 * Bachelor's degree or higher in Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Math, Economics, Engineering, Analytics, or similar quantitative STEM field.
 * Relevant professional work experience (paid, non-academic, non-intern) OR an advanced degree in one or more of the above disciplines.
 * High proficiency and professional experience coding in SQL, Python and/or R (tested during interviews).
 * High proficiency and professional experience with Excel, PowerPoint and Tableau.
 * High proficiency and professional experience with data acquisition, data manipulation, data cleaning.
 * High proficiency and professional experience identifying trends and indicators through quantitative and qualitative analysis.
 * Proficiency with statistics and predictive modelling techniques.
 * Comfort with presenting ideas virtually or in-person to audiences of various sizes.
 * Ability to collaborate effectively with others as well as work independently while in a hybrid work environment.
   
   

Added bonus if candidates have (Preferred):


 * MBA or advanced degree in Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Math, Economics, Engineering, Analytics, or similar quantitative STEM field.
 * Professional work experience in auto financing, consumer lending and/or financial institutions.
 * Professional work experience in consumer credit risk, business analytics, finance and/or pricing roles.
   
   

Pay Range: $35 - $40.44 Hourly

title: Data Analyst

description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst I, you will be responsible for working closely with many divisions of the company such as Product Development and Adoption, Technology, Performance, Growth, and Strategic Payer Partnerships. This position develops moderately complex datasets, assists with complex dataset updates and modifications, and develops data visualizations and analyses that answer a broad set of questions across the company and begin to go deeper as a subject matter expert in at least one subdomain. You work closely with other BI team members on a daily basis and have direct exposure with stakeholders across the company. You will be knowledgeable in healthcare analytics, population health, and value-based care.

We are flexible with geographic location—the ideal candidate can work remotely from anywhere in the U.S. or from our headquarters in Bethesda, MD.

Primary Duties:


 * Working with teams across Aledade to translate your findings into action. You will build interactive dashboards, reports and powerpoints that effectively communicate insights and motivate action among our internal business operations and partner practices.
 * Assist with the design of and directly implement data warehouse tables or views to support analysis and reporting
 * Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to support data driven decision making across many company divisions.
 * Provides end user support to internal audiences for existing dashboards.
   
   

Minimum Qualifications:


 * 1+ years of experience in business intelligence
 * Experience analyzing data and communicating results in data visualizations, dashboards, and reports for a wide variety of audiences (company/ACO executives, internal staff, physicians, etc.)
   
   

Preferred knowledge, skills, and/or abilities:


 * 1+ years of experience working with healthcare data (e.g. claims, EHR, clinical)
 * Experience in data management and data manipulation skills, including a strong foundation in SQL programming
 * Experience providing internal end-user support for reporting products, including answering technical questions, troubleshooting, and providing training.
 * Intense attention to detail and data quality assurance.
 * Strong quantitative skills: 1) Advanced proficiency with SQL (e.g. understands window functions) and/or 2.) Proficient with a BI dashboarding tool (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
 * Tableau experience
 * Familiarity with dbt or another data transformation tool (e.g. SSIS, Alteryx)
   
   

Physical Requirements:


 * Sitting for prolonged periods of time. Extensive use of computers and keyboard. Occasional walking and lifting may be required.

description:
Why Join our Team? At Vallen, we embrace what makes us unique. We thrive on the diversity of our associates and the different ways each of us contributes to Vallen’s success. We pride ourselves on being an inclusive company that values the growth of our associates. When you join Vallen, you become part of our winning team. Position Summary:

Join the Vallen Team as the Data and Analytics Analyst. In this role you will play an integral role in advancing the organization’s data-driven decision-making capabilities. This position involves the development and optimization of analytics tools, reporting mechanisms, and automated workflows to enhance operational efficiencies and provide actionable insights across various functions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


 * Power BI Expertise: Develop and manage interactive dashboards and visualizations to communicate key metrics and insights effectively.
 * Report Design: Create and troubleshoot operational and strategic reports using Microsoft Report Builder.
 * Process Automation: Leverage Power Automate to streamline workflows and enhance data integration processes.
 * Advanced Microsoft Office Applications
 * Utilize Excel for advanced data analysis, including the creation of complex formulas, pivot tables, and macros.
 * Develop professional, visually engaging presentations in PowerPoint to effectively convey data-driven insights.
 * Produce clear, comprehensive documentation and reports using Microsoft Word.
 * SQL Development: Design, develop, and maintain complex SQL queries and stored procedures to support data extraction, transformation, and reporting activities.
 * Collaborate with internal stakeholders to gather requirements, define analytical needs, and ensure the delivery of accurate and reliable data solutions.
 * Monitor and maintain data quality, integrity, and security across organizational systems.
 * Identify and propose innovative solutions for improving processes and enhancing data utilization.
   
   
   

Job Qualifications:


 * Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
 * Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with a demonstrated ability to convey technical concepts to diverse audiences.
 * Outstanding organizational and project management skills, with the ability to balance multiple priorities effectively.
   
   
   

Preferred Qualifications:


 * Experience within the distribution or supply chain industry.
 * Familiarity with additional analytics or visualization tools such as Tableau or Python.
 * Knowledge of cloud-based data services, including Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
   
   
   

Work Environment & Physical Demands:

Reasonable accommodations will be evaluated and may be implemented to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions of this position.


 * This job operates in a professional office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, etc.
 * Long periods of time working on a computer and performing repetitive key-boarding activities.
 * Evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand and may include little to no advanced notice.
 * While performing the duties of this job, associates are regularly required to sit and stand.
 * May be required to lift up to 25 pounds.
 * Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus
   
   
   

Stay up to date with Vallen, and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

description:
Title: Workday Reporting & Analytics Analyst
Location: Katy, TX (Onsite Daily)
Duration: Permanent, Direct-Hire
Work Requirements: US Citizen, GC Holders or Authorized to Work in the US.
 
Key Points:

 * This position is 100% onsite daily. It is NOT remote.
 * Strong experience with Workday PRISM Analytics is required.

 
Work Experience Requirements:
 * 2+ years of advanced Workday reporting, data/analytics; and visualization, including calculated fields, dashboards, and PRISM is highly preferred.
 * 1+ years of UKG Dimensions or Workforce Central (Legacy Kronos) Analytics module is highly preferred.
 * 2+ years of demonstrated experience in Human Resources analytics required.
 * 3+ years of experience using advanced Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools required.

 
Other Qualifications:
 * Workday PRISM, BIRT, and composite reporting experience.
 * Proficient in creating and maintaining complex calculated fields.
 * Expert level understanding of Excel (complex formula creation, advanced data presentation/design and analysis).
 * Results-focused with superb attention to detail, accuracy, and follow-through.
 * Strong math and analytical aptitude.
 * Ability to analyze complex and sometimes limited data sets.
 * Ability to identify trends that drive impactful business recommendations.
 * Analytical, with strong problem-solving abilities and creative resolution skills.
 * Ability to remain organized, work autonomously, execute flawlessly, pay strict attention to detail, and meet critical deadlines within a dynamic high volume, fast-paced environment.
 * Self-motivated, with the ability to meet and exceed position requirements under minimal direction and supervision.
 * Excellent time management skills, ability to support multiple projects, and effectively manage a large volume of work.
 * Self-starter with ability to conceptualize and collaborate in order to translate business needs into meaningful analytics/outputs.
 * Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interface effectively with individuals at various.
 * levels, both internal and external.
 * Ability to operate professionally, effectively, and ethically as an individual contributor and member of a team.
 * Proficient with use of Microsoft Office suite of programs: Word, Access, and PowerPoint.

 
Responsibilities:
 * Collaborate with process owners to independently design, develop, maintain, and test simple to complex reports and visualizations, including but not limited to advanced, matrix, composite reports, metrics/KPIs, and dashboards utilizing Workday Report Writer, Worksheets, Discovery Boards, and Slides, as well as other tools and available technologies; keeping standard, enterprise-wide use in mind to achieve maximum efficiencies and align with the overall business strategy.
 * Own creation, validation, and execution of all scheduled and custom/published HR reporting.
 * Building complex reports and analytics using UKG Dimensions Analytics module.
 * Identify opportunities for process optimization through use of analytic tools/reports across all HR functions. Make operational/strategic recommendations for identified opportunities and implement solutions, leading all subsequent design, development and testing efforts required to deliver.
 * Leverage data from Workday to analyze trends in areas such as turnover, retention, talent acquisition, employee relations, talent management and engagement, making recommendations on process improvements and HR operations/strategy based on findings.
 * Own HR budget process, managing all internal HR and external department reporting and collection of data, delivering error-free and on time, while also identifying and implementing process improvements as needed.
 * Utilize discretion and judgment to maintain confidentiality of sensitive data.
 * Regularly evaluate HCM data to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
 * Performs or manages any necessary data clean-up or sanitization through the appropriate team.
 * Support system implementations, as needed, to identify how to leverage the system to best meet the organization's analytics needs.
 * Provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers in order to drive business decisions and address business questions.
 * Create and maintain related calculated fields for reporting and communicate calculated fields needs across areas to avoid redundancy and achieve efficiency.
 * Develop and maintain advanced analytics solutions using Workday Prism Analytics and associated data sources.
 * Learns and follows company work hours, policies, procedures, and rules governing professional staff behavior.
 * Responsibilities may change; team member may be required to perform other duties as assigned.

 
Education:
 * Bachelor's degree in related field of study or equivalent years of related work experience preferred.

Business Unit Business Information

title: Systems Analyst (Data Analytics)

description:
The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting various datasets to enable insights and initiatives to drive business growth, improve customer retention, inform strategic decisions, and grant valuable insights to various stakeholders who support the Government sales channel inside Thomson Reuters.

The successful candidate must be agile and responsive to the dynamic Government market and evolving internal processes, tools, and commercial strategies. This individual should be well organized, creative, a strategic thinker, and have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

About the Role:


 * Streamlining data collection methods to create automated and easy-to-use dashboards and reports – important data points include sales and retention analysis, customer behavior metrics, and commercial analysis.
 * Maintaining data systems by addressing errors and monitoring performance, specifically around customer data
 * Analyzing collected data and putting it into a format that others can easily interpret
 * Interpreting data trends and patterns as they relate to the organization
 * Preparing reports for organizational leadership to use in a business setting
 * Improve customer tagging and segmentation to enhance analysis and reporting
 * Collaborating with others to determine areas of improvement in relation to data
 * Develop an understanding of business partner needs, current state and develop designs for future state
   
   
   

About You:

Background


 * 2+ years of experience as a Customer Data Analyst or equivalent experience in data or business analytics
 * Bachelor’s degree: Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Analytics, Finance, or related field is preferred
   
   
   

Skills


 * Analytical: Interprets data to identify customer behavior and preferences.
 * Data Visualization: Creates interactive and static visualizations to convey complex insights.
 * Technical Aptitude: Quickly learns and applies new technologies.
 * Project Management: Manages multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery.
 * Solution-oriented: Develops and implements effective solutions to problems.
 * Reliable: Meets deadlines and maintains quality under pressure.
 * Flexible: Adapts to changing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
 * Strong Communication: Influences and persuades colleagues, customers, and stakeholders through effective communication.
 * Self-starter: Takes ownership of projects, resolving problems independently.
   
   
   

Tool / System Experience


 * Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and MS Teams.
 * Strong experience with data analysis tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, and Alteryx
 * Familiarity with the following technologies is beneficial: Python, SQL, SAP, and Business Objects
   
   
   

What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:


 * Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected
 * Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
 * Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
 * Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
 * Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
 * Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
   
   
   

In the United States, Thomson Reuters offers a comprehensive benefits package to our employees. Our benefit package includes market competitive health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance programs, as well as a competitive 401k plan with company match. In addition, Thomson Reuters offers market leading work life benefits with competitive vacation, sick and safe paid time off, paid holidays (including two company mental health days off), parental leave, sabbatical leave. These benefits meet or exceeds the requirements of paid time off in accordance with any applicable state or municipal laws. Finally, Thomson Reuters offers the following additional benefits: optional hospital, accident and sickness insurance paid 100% by the employee; optional life and AD&D insurance paid 100% by the employee; Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts; fitness reimbursement; access to Employee Assistance Program; Group Legal Identity Theft Protection benefit paid 100% by employee; access to 529 Plan; commuter benefits; Adoption & Surrogacy Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement; and access to Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The base compensation range varies across locations. Eligible office location(s) for this role include one or more of the following: New York City, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and/or Irvine, CA; McLean, VA; Washington, DC. The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $81,600 - $151,600. Eagan, MN; Ann Arbor, MI; Richmond, VA; Rochester, NY. The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $70,500 - $130,900. Chicago, IL; Frisco, TX; Houston, TX; fully remote location. For these locations and any eligible US locations not otherwise noted, including for fully remote location if applicable, the base compensation range for this role is $74,200 - $137,800. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance. Base pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay is one part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

title: Data Analyst, Government

description:
Truveta is the world’s first health provider led data platform with a vision of Saving Lives with Data. Our mission is to enable researchers to find cures faster, empower every clinician to be an expert, and help families make the most informed decisions about their care. Achieving Truveta’ s ambitious vision requires an incredible team of talented and inspired people with a special combination of health, software and big data experience who share our company values.

This role will be based out of our office in the Greater Seattle area.

Who We Need

Truveta is rapidly building a talented and diverse team to tackle complex health and technical challenges. Beyond core capabilities, we are seeking problem solvers, passionate and collaborative teammates, and those willing to roll up their sleeves while making a difference. If you are interested in the opportunity to pursue purposeful work, join a mission-driven team, and build a rewarding career while having fun, Truveta may be the perfect fit for you.

Internship Details

Our clinical data analyst internship is designed for candidates who are pursuing their senior year of undergraduate or graduate programs. Candidates must be graduating within a year of the internship. This will be a 3-month internship.

This Opportunity

Truveta is building the leading platform for medical research on one of the largest and most comprehensive clinical data sets in the country. This role will primarily focus on performing data analyses to support various healthcare projects and initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, an interest in healthcare data, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. 

Responsibilities


 * Ad Hoc Analysis: Conduct detailed ad hoc analyses to address specific business questions or challenges. This may include data extraction, manipulation, and reporting.
 * Data Collection & Preparation: Use Databricks, SQL, and Excel to collect and analyze data
 * Collaboration: Work closely with senior analysts, healthcare professionals, and other team members to understand analysis requirements and provide data-driven insights.
 * Data Quality Assurance: Verify data integrity and accuracy of outputs independently and by maintaining best practices such as code review
 * Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of methodologies, processes, and findings to support reproducibility and knowledge sharing.
 * Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in healthcare analytics and data science.
   
   

Key Qualifications


 * Experience using SQL, Python; PowerBI is a plus
 * Exposure to ML/AI preferred
 * Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
 * Current or recent students in B.S. in Computer Science or related field is required
   
   

Why Truveta?

Be a part of building something special. Now is the perfect time to join Truveta. We have strong, established leadership with decades of success. We are well-funded. We are building a culture that prioritizes people and their passions across personal, professional and everything in between. Join us as we build an amazing company together.

We Offer


 * Monthly stipend of $1,800-$2,200
 * Company-issued laptop and equipment
 * Opportunities for future full-time positions
   
   

Truveta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Clinical Data Analyst Intern

description:
Location: USA - St. Louis

Experience: 3 - 5 Years

Must-Have

Minimum of 3-years of relevant experience in data analysis, preferably with a background in ESG or ESH.

Familiarity with Enablon or a willingness to undergo training to effectively use the platform for reporting.

Proficient with Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Visio, and SharePoint.

Summary Of Position

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented ESG Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will have experience in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG), or Environmental Safety and Health (ESH). This role offers a unique opportunity to work cross-functionally with departments such as Health Physics, Facilities, Safety, and Supply Chain to support data collection, analysis, and reporting related to waste disposal, energy audits, refrigerant gas inventory, safety data, and ESG performance. The successful candidate will conduct comprehensive ESG research, identify key risks and opportunities, and help implement sustainability initiatives.

Work Schedule: 20 hours a week for the first 4 months, then 10 hours per week

Essential Functions


 * Conduct comprehensive ESG research and analysis, evaluating the company’s performance against industry-specific criteria and standards.
 * Identify key ESG risks, opportunities, and trends, providing insights to support strategic decision-making and risk mitigation.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to develop and implement ESG strategies, policies, and initiatives that align with sustainability objectives.
 * Monitor and measure ESG performance indicators, track progress, and produce regular reports to communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders.
 * Stay updated on evolving ESG regulations, industry best practices, and emerging sustainability trends, incorporating them into organizational strategies.
 * Partner with Health Physics to manage the disposal of non-hazardous, hazardous, and radioactive waste at sites.
 * Work with Facilities in executing an Energy Audit, and in the organization and analysis of the data for plants, and to track and report inventory.
 * Assist the Safety team in preparing and submitting safety data reports.
 * Collaborate with the Supply Chain team on reporting through the Interlog system.
 * Complete Enablon training and use the platform for data collection and reporting.
 * Must maintain operational compliance with US and international regulatory agencies and guidelines (i.e. FDA, EU, HC, TGA, PIC/S, ISO, USP, NRC, cGMP, etc.)
   
   

Requirements


 * Bachelor Degree preferred or equivalent work experience in lieue of a degree
 * Minimum of three years of relevant experience in data analysis, preferably with a background in ESG or ESH.
 * Proficiency in data management and reporting tools.
 * Strong ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams across departments.
 * Familiarity with Enablon or a willingness to undergo training to effectively use the platform for reporting.
 * Proficient with Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Visio and SharePoint.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills required for developing communications, coupled with strong listening, interpersonal and customer service skills.
 * Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven ability to respond to rapidly changing business needs, and meet deadlines.
   
   

Skills: enviromental,data collection,large-scale data analysis,esg,data analysis,time management,social analytics,enablon,microsoft office,data,esh,cross-functional collaboration,reporting,data management,sustainability
title: Data Analyst - ESG/ESH

description:
Overview

Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) delivers high-impact, technical solutions to complex national security issues. With over 50 years of business expertise and consistent growth, we are known for continuous innovation for our government customers, in both the US and abroad. Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter. Come work with the best! We offer opportunity, unique challenges, and clear-sighted commitment to the mission. SPA: Objective. Responsive. Trusted.

The Joint, Office of the Secretary of Defense, Interagency Division provides expert support services to a range of customers spanning across the Department of Defense, Federal Civilian, and international markets. JOID provides a diverse portfolio of analytical and programmatic capabilities to help our customers make informed decisions on their most challenging issues.

The Critical Infrastructure Group (CIG) within JOID provides technical, programmatic and analytical support to customers with missions in national security to include the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Health and Human Services (HHS), and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). The Group brings technical and operational expertise in fields of countering weapons of mass destruction, critical infrastructure protection, emergency response, nuclear non-proliferation, weapons deployment programs, and transportation safety. In addition to management and advisory services, CIG staff collaborate closely with our clients to provide high-quality modeling, simulation, software, and analytical products to meet the most demanding government standards and timelines.

We have an immediate need for a Data Analyst to provide support to DHS Customs and Border Protection (CBP) customers located in Washington, DC. This position allows for a hybrid work schedule.

Responsibilities

The candidate will develop and apply analytic methodologies and principles, including data mining, text analytics, business intelligence, modeling data, and qualitative, quantitative, and data visualization in support of ongoing initiatives. Apply data analysis experience and assist in the application of analytic techniques and provide recommendations for objective and strategic direction. Assist in resolving complex problems which require in-depth knowledge of analytic methodologies and principles. Assist in analyzing program management and acquisition data and develop data visualizations and dashboards to facilitate management decisions. Design and develop materials, evaluating the effectiveness in accordance with stated Guidelines, Directives, Standard Operating Procedures, specifications, and models. Assist in conducting research, data gathering, and technical reviews. Produce written deliverables to include reports, spreadsheets, databases, formal processes, mapping, technical design, and system testing and implementation activities.

Qualifications

Required:


 * Ability to obtain and retain a CBP Background Investigation.
 * Bachelors degree and 3+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization
 * Experience developing and applying analytic methodologies and principles, including data mining, text analytics, business intelligence, modeling data, qualitative, quantitative, and data visualization, in support of ongoing initiatives.
 * Have demonstrable data analysis experience, assist in the application of analytic techniques, and provide recommendations for objective and strategic direction.
 * Experience with business applications and data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
   
   

Desired


 * Active DHS Suitability or CBP Background Investigation
 * Experience providing similar support to DHS, with CBP experience highly preferred.
   
   

Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are commensurate with experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Salary transparency pay range for the Washington DC area: $105k-$125k
sector: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing, and Armed Forces
title: Data Analyst

description:
Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, offer buy now, pay later functionality, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

The Team

The Square App Marketplace connects developers and sellers in a robust ecosystem that enhances Square's core capabilities through third-party applications. Developers create solutions that integrate seamlessly with Square, extending functionality across areas like inventory management, loyalty programs, and customer engagement. By listing their apps on the Square App Marketplace, developers have the opportunity to reach millions of businesses that rely on Square to run and grow. This thriving, two-sided marketplace not only empowers developers to innovate but also enables sellers to customize and optimize their Square experience with powerful, third-party tools. Our team is dedicated to powering data-driven insights that enhance the Square App Marketplace and developer experience. By providing strategic and analytical support, the Developer Analytics Team enables data insights that drive growth and inform business decisions, helping sellers maximize the value of the Square ecosystem.

The Role

The Senior Data Analyst will be a key member of the Developers and App Marketplace Analytics team, driving data-informed decision-making across the organization. In this role, you’ll oversee essential dashboards, ensure data quality, and maintain key metrics. You’ll collaborate with Product Managers and Engineers to launch and assess the impact of new and improved features, while partnering with Marketing Managers to evaluate the effectiveness of GTM activities. Additionally, you'll play a vital role in streamlining our dashboards and pipelines and in establishing strong documentation practices.

You Will


 * Design and develop databases, build intuitive dashboards, and define key metrics to support, scale, and analyze data. Create clear, insightful reports that make complex information accessible to stakeholders across the organization..
 * Write complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from various databases to fulfill ad-hoc requests.
 * Set best practices for data quality management and documentation, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and transparency across our data ecosystem.
 * Uncover relevant insights on topics affecting developers experience and app marketplace performance, including: product launches and usage, and key performance.
   
   

You Have


 * 3+ years of related experience
 * Expert level abilities in SQL and data analysis/visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Looker)
 * Vision to define problems and manage projects in a fast-­paced, evolving organization.
 * Ability to work independently and manage multiple concurrent requests and projects.
 * Experience using data to solve complex, ambiguous problems.
 * Excellent project management skills, stakeholder management skills, and communication skills.
 * Strongly preferred experience in financial services, fintech, financial crimes, or compliance.
 * Good to have experience using Python, R and Airflow.
   
   

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is an equal opportunity employer evaluating all employees and job applicants without regard to identity or any legally protected class. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.

Block will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances.

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information.

Zone A

$135,200—$202,800 USD

Zone B

$125,800—$188,600 USD

Zone C

$119,000—$178,400 USD

Zone D

$108,200—$162,200 USD

Every benefit we offer is designed with one goal: empowering you to do the best work of your career while building the life you want. Check out benefits at Block.

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, and TIDAL, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.
