title: Sustainability Data Analyst

description:
Become a part of our caring community and help us put health first

The Data and Reporting Professional 2 generates ad hoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts. The Data and Reporting Professional 2 work assignments are varied and frequently require interpretation and independent determination of the appropriate courses of action.

The Data and Reporting Professional 2 integrates data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements. Programs and maintains report forms and formats, information dashboards, data generators, canned reports and other end-user information portals or resources. May create specifications for reports based on business requests. Understands department, segment, and organizational strategy and operating objectives, including their linkages to related areas. Makes decisions regarding own work methods, occasionally in ambiguous situations, and requires minimal direction and receives guidance where needed. Follows established guidelines/procedures.

The Ideal Applicant Will Possess The Following Skills


 * Report Automation
 * Data Movement
 * Communication Effectiveness
 * Detail-Oriented
 * Data Analysis Software
 * Data Mining
 * Core Systems
 * Active Learning
 * Problem Solving
 * Listening
 * Database Structures
 * Data Administration
 * Producing Results
 * Data Gathering
 * Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
 * Highly Organized
   
   

Required Qualifications

Use your skills to make an impact


 * Minimum 1 year of experience in SQL
 * Minimum 1 year of experience creating automated reports and self-service tools
 * In-depth experience in Microsoft Excel including formulas, pivots, charts, and graphs
 * Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications including Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint
 * Excellent organizational skills
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Experience in SAS, QlikView, Power BI, and Tableau
 * Experience in managed care or health care sector
 * Prior experience working in a system analytics and/or data warehousing environment
   
   

Prefer Location: Kentucky Central or Eastern Time Zone


 * This role will require travel to the local office for meetings at least four times a year
   
   

Work schedule: Monday through Friday 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Time

Work at Home Guidance To ensure Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees’ ability to work effectively, the self-provided internet service of Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees must meet the following criteria: At minimum, a download speed of 25 Mbps and an upload speed of 10 Mbps is recommended; wireless, wired cable or DSL connection is suggested. Satellite, cellular and microwave connection can be used only if approved by leadership. Employees who live and work from Home in the state of California, Illinois, Montana, or South Dakota will be provided a bi-weekly payment for their internet expense.

Humana will provide Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees with telephone equipment appropriate to meet the business requirements for their position/job. Work from a dedicated space lacking ongoing interruptions to protect member PHI / HIPAA information.

Additional Information

Interview Format

As part of our hiring process, we will be using an exciting interviewing technology provided by HireVue, a third-party vendor. This technology provides our team of recruiters and hiring managers an enhanced method for decision-making.

If you are selected to move forward from your application prescreen, you will receive an email correspondence inviting you to participate in a pre-recorded Voice Interview and/or an SMS Text Messaging interview. (please be sure to check your spam or junk folders often to ensure communication isn’t missed) If participating in a pre-recorded interview, you will respond to a set of interview questions via your phone. You should anticipate this interview to take approximately 10-15 minutes.

If participating in a SMS Text interview, you will be asked a series of questions to which you will be using your cell phone to answer the questions provided. Expect this type of interview to last anywhere from 5-10 minutes. Your recorded interview(s) via text and/or pre-recorded voice will be reviewed and you will subsequently be informed if you will be moving forward to next round of interviews.

SSN Alert Humana values personal identity protection. Please be aware that applicants may be asked to provide their Social Security Number, if it is not already on file. When required, an email will be sent from Humana@myworkday.com with instructions on how to add the information into your official application on Humana’s secure website.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Pay Range

The compensation range below reflects a good faith estimate of starting base pay for full time (40 hours per week) employment at the time of posting. The pay range may be higher or lower based on geographic location and individual pay will vary based on demonstrated job related skills, knowledge, experience, education, certifications, etc.

$60,800 - $82,900 per year

Description Of Benefits

Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, “Humana”) offers benefits for limited term, variable schedule and per diem associates which are designed to support whole-person well-being. Among these benefits, Humana provides paid time off, 401(k) retirement savings plan, employee assistance program, business travel and accident.

About Us

Humana Inc. (NYSE: HUM) is committed to putting health first – for our teammates, our customers and our company. Through our Humana insurance services and CenterWell healthcare services, we make it easier for the millions of people we serve to achieve their best health – delivering the care and service they need, when they need it. These efforts are leading to a better quality of life for people with Medicare, Medicaid, families, individuals, military service personnel, and communities at large.

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Humana not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or veteran status. It is also the policy of Humana to take affirmative action to employ and to advance in employment, all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status, and to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements. This policy shall apply to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including apprenticeship, at all levels of employment.

 * This role will require travel to the local office for meetings at least four times a year
   
   

Work schedule: Monday through Friday 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Time

Work at Home Guidance To ensure Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees’ ability to work effectively, the self-provided internet service of Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees must meet the following criteria: At minimum, a download speed of 25 Mbps and an upload speed of 10 Mbps is recommended; wireless, wired cable or DSL connection is suggested. Satellite, cellular and microwave connection can be used only if approved by leadership. Employees who live and work from Home in the state of California, Illinois, Montana, or South Dakota will be provided a bi-weekly payment for their internet expense.

Humana will provide Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees with telephone equipment appropriate to meet the business requirements for their position/job. Work from a dedicated space lacking ongoing interruptions to protect member PHI / HIPAA information.

Additional Information

Interview Format

As part of our hiring process, we will be using an exciting interviewing technology provided by HireVue, a third-party vendor. This technology provides our team of recruiters and hiring managers an enhanced method for decision-making.

If you are selected to move forward from your application prescreen, you will receive an email correspondence inviting you to participate in a pre-recorded Voice Interview and/or an SMS Text Messaging interview. (please be sure to check your spam or junk folders often to ensure communication isn’t missed) If participating in a pre-recorded interview, you will respond to a set of interview questions via your phone. You should anticipate this interview to take approximately 10-15 minutes.

If participating in a SMS Text interview, you will be asked a series of questions to which you will be using your cell phone to answer the questions provided. Expect this type of interview to last anywhere from 5-10 minutes. Your recorded interview(s) via text and/or pre-recorded voice will be reviewed and you will subsequently be informed if you will be moving forward to next round of interviews.

SSN Alert Humana values personal identity protection. Please be aware that applicants may be asked to provide their Social Security Number, if it is not already on file. When required, an email will be sent from Humana@myworkday.com with instructions on how to add the information into your official application on Humana’s secure website.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Pay Range

The compensation range below reflects a good faith estimate of starting base pay for full time (40 hours per week) employment at the time of posting. The pay range may be higher or lower based on geographic location and individual pay will vary based on demonstrated job related skills, knowledge, experience, education, certifications, etc.

$60,800 - $82,900 per year

Description Of Benefits

Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, “Humana”) offers benefits for limited term, variable schedule and per diem associates which are designed to support whole-person well-being. Among these benefits, Humana provides paid time off, 401(k) retirement savings plan, employee assistance program, business travel and accident.

About Us

Humana Inc. (NYSE: HUM) is committed to putting health first – for our teammates, our customers and our company. Through our Humana insurance services and CenterWell healthcare services, we make it easier for the millions of people we serve to achieve their best health – delivering the care and service they need, when they need it. These efforts are leading to a better quality of life for people with Medicare, Medicaid, families, individuals, military service personnel, and communities at large.

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Humana not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or veteran status. It is also the policy of Humana to take affirmative action to employ and to advance in employment, all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status, and to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements. This policy shall apply to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including apprenticeship, at all levels of employment.

description:
For over 35 years, Genpro Inc. has lived on the pulse of the freight marketplace, deploying smart solutions that keep our customers moving forward. Our focus every day is to provide cost-effective solutions, maintain clear and transparent communications, and be the go-to, reliable logistics provider. From expedited services for perishable products to drop-trailer projects during surges, to optimizing your inbound network to control costs - our innovation provides the solution.




If you are looking for an innovative and entrepreneurial environment where you can utilize and develop your skills, be recognized and rewarded for your efforts, and be an integral part of the corporate strategy, Genpro Inc. is the place for you.




POSITION SUMMARY:




We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Logistics Data Analyst to join our supply chain and logistics team. This role focuses on managing and optimizing pricing strategies for transportation lanes, analyzing data to support strategic decision-making, and preparing comprehensive responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs). With expertise in Excel, SQL, and data analysis, this individual will support decision-making processes through actionable insights and manage RFP processes and lane pricing strategies. This person should be able to have an understanding of market dynamics in freight, logistics, and transportation.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Request for Proposal (RFP) Management:

 * Support the preparation, evaluation, and analysis of RFPs related to transportation and logistics.
 * Collaborate with the Sales Team to respond to RFPs for transportation and logistics services, ensuring competitive and profitable pricing.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define bid requirements and evaluate carrier proposals.

Lane Pricing:

 * Develop pricing models and strategies for freight lanes across various modes of transportation (e.g., truckload, LTL, intermodal).
 * Conduct competitive market analyses to ensure pricing aligns with market trends and business objectives.
 * Continuously review and refine lane pricing based on profitability and operational feasibility.

Data Analytics:

 * Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities within the supply chain.
 * Develop dashboards and reports to provide visibility into pricing, lane performance, and key metrics.
 * Use statistical methods and predictive analytics to support pricing and operational decisions.

Data Management & Tools:

 * Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data using SQL to maintain database integrity and accuracy.
 * Leverage advanced Excel techniques (e.g., macros, pivot tables, VLOOKUPs) for data manipulation and analysis.

Continuous Improvement:

 * Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of supply chain processes, providing recommendations for improvement.
 * Support the implementation of tools and systems to enhance operational efficiency.







QUALIFICATIONS

 * Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Data Analytics, Business, or a related field.
 * 3-5+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the supply chain or logistics domain.
 * Proficiency in SQL for database querying and analysis.
 * Understanding of market dynamics in freight, logistics, and transportation
 * Advanced Excel skills, including VBA, pivot tables, and complex formulas.
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and present data-driven insights.
 * Familiarity with RFP processes and transportation pricing strategies.
 * Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
 * Logistics, Transportation, or Supply Chain background preferred.
 * An innate ability to build strong relationships with businesses and decision-makers.
 * Strong written & oral communication skills.
 * An analytical problem solver who sees issues as opportunities.
 * Must be within a commutable distance to Rutherford, NJ.







You’ll truly appreciate what Genpro Inc. has to offer:




Exceptional Culture - We prioritize connection through our quarterly town hall meetings, monthly festivities, and holiday gatherings, fostering a strong sense of community.

Diversity & Inclusion - We value the unique perspectives of each team member, believing that this diversity is essential for a collaborative atmosphere filled with innovative ideas.

Opportunities for Growth - Our hire-to-retire philosophy ensures that employees have unparalleled chances for career progression and professional growth.

Rewarding Referral Program - Our team loves what they do, and there’s nothing better than inviting friends to join in on the excitement!

Employee-Focused Organization - Our team members are central to our mission, and we believe that a satisfied and engaged team delivers exceptional performance.

Additional Benefits - We provide a competitive PTO, health/dental/vision coverage, and a 401K match.







Genpro Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, national origin, ethnicity, military/veteran status, or disability which can be reasonably accommodated without undue hardship, or any other classification protected by law. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment including recruitment, hiring, compensation, training, promotions, terminations, layoffs, transfers, and leaves of absence.

Company Overview:

Our client is an innovative leader in the manufacturing and sales industry, seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join their growing team. This onsite role in Seattle, WA, involves working closely with leadership to analyze data and deliver actionable insights that drive business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, proficiency in data tools, and a passion for problem-solving and continuous improvement.




ONLY ACCEPTING LOCAL CANDIDATES




Key Responsibilities:

 * Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and support strategic business decisions.
 * Reporting and Dashboarding: Build and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key metrics, operational performance, and business outcomes.
 * Business Insights: Collaborate with sales, operations, and leadership teams to provide actionable insights and recommendations for business growth and efficiency.
 * Data Management: Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across systems and processes.
 * Process Improvement: Identify and implement opportunities to enhance data processes and reporting frameworks.
 * Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with various departments to address their data needs and deliver customized analytical solutions.

Qualifications:

 * Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to analyze, interpret, and visualize complex data.
 * Advanced Excel Proficiency: Experience with tools like Pivot Tables, Index Match, and Macros.
 * Data Tools Expertise: Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and query languages (e.g., SQL).
 * Problem-Solving Mindset: Ability to identify challenges and develop solutions independently.
 * Collaboration Skills: Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
 * Proactive and Self-Motivated: Demonstrated ability to take ownership of projects and work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Experience:

 * 3+ years of professional experience in data analytics or business analysis.
 * Experience supporting sales operations or similar business functions.
 * Familiarity with tools and systems commonly used in tech or manufacturing industries.

Character Traits:

 * Proactive: Takes initiative and drives projects forward with minimal supervision.
 * Willingness to Learn: Eager to develop new skills and grow within the role.
 * Team-Oriented: Values collaboration and maintains a positive, solution-focused attitude.

What We Offer:

 * Competitive Salary: $100K - $140K DOE.
 * Comprehensive Benefits Package: Health, dental, and vision insurance.
 * Retirement Plans: 401(k) with company contributions.

Apply now to make a significant impact as a Data Analyst with our forward-thinking team!
title: Data Analyst

description:
Description

Rivanna Medical, Inc. is seeking an experienced Clinical Data Analyst to contribute to the rapid growth of our emerging medical device company. You will work within a talented team of professionals as we strive to achieve our mission of improving global human health. The ideal candidate has prior successful experience managing large imaging datasets and analyzing multi-variate data to drive business decision-making. This is a hands-on multidisciplinary role in which the right candidate will work closely with our engineering, R&D and clinical teams to analyze complex ultrasound data, develop predictive models, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our products. The Data Scientist will be responsible for overseeing the data analytics projects related to clinical and development datasets.

Requirements

Responsibilities:


 * Analyze and interpret large datasets generated from ultrasound imaging to identify trends, patterns, and insights to drive product development decision-making.
 * Support the development of machine learning models to improve ultrasound image quality, detect anomalies, and assist in diagnostics.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide actionable insights.
 * Implement data processing pipelines to handle real-time and batch ultrasound data.
 * Create visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings and support clinical decision-making.
 * Stay current with the latest advancements in data science and ultrasound technology.
 * Work with external statisticians to power appropriately clinical studies and analyze results.
 * Develop and implement statistical models and algorithms to solve complex problems.
 * Collaborate with other teams to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
   
   

Requirements:


 * PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, or a related field.
 * Proven experience with machine learning, deep learning, and data analysis, preferably in the medical imaging or healthcare industry.
 * Strong statistical background.
 * Proficiency in Python or R, and experience with machine learning frameworks.
 * Strong understanding of image processing techniques and algorithms.
 * Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) and big data technologies.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 * Ability to communicate complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience with ultrasound imaging data and healthcare datasets.
 * Knowledge of medical device regulatory requirements and standards (e.g., FDA, CE) and AI technology validation.
 * Background in signal processing or biomedical engineering is a plus.
 * Experience with imaging and diagnostic test analysis such as Dice score calculations, ROC, and AUC curve creation.
   
   

About Rivanna Medical, Inc.: Rivanna Medical, Inc. is a privately held designer, manufacturer, and distributor of world-first, imaging-based medical solutions based in Charlottesville, VA. Rivanna Medical, Inc. operates an FDA-registered and ISO 13485:2016 certified manufacturing facility where it produces the Accuro® product line and related medical equipment and components. Accuro is the world's first spinal navigation device designed to improve the safety, speed, and efficiency of spinal needle guidance procedures. Rivanna Medical, Inc.'s revolutionary platforms feature BoneEnhance® Multi-Frequency Image Reconstruction, which optimizes ultrasound for the visualization of bony versus soft tissue anatomy, and SpineNav3D™ AI-Based Spine Recognition, which automates ultrasound image interpretation.

Employee Benefits at Rivanna Medical, Inc.: Rivanna Medical, Inc. offers a comprehensive benefits package, which includes health insurance, vision and dental coverage, group life insurance, long-term disability insurance, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with company match, and more. We are continually seeking to enhance our team with individuals who bring unique perspectives and experiences. This diversity of thought and perspective drives innovation and strengthens our commitment to creating an inclusive team environment where our core values of trust, humility, and dedication are practiced every day.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: Rivanna Medical, Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, color, sex (including childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, uniform service member and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. All employees must be able to lift at least 25 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their positions.

The Analyst is responsible for the accuracy of master data records contained in the SAP system. This includes the addition, deletion and maintenance of data. The Analyst will also serve as the SME to other Business units within the organization to provide problem resolution as it relates to SAP, process, new business requirements and master data information. The Master Data Analyst facilitates the implementation and support of SAP products to enhance business functionality and overall performance, while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities, And Key Accountabilities


 * Provides accurate and appropriate interpretation of data, applying knowledge to evaluation, and analysis.
 * Troubleshoot concerns highlighted by the business units supported and analyze/complete service requests to drive sales and profit growth.
 * Ad-hoc assignments related to data integrity.
 * Provide SAP master data support for Merchandising, Finance, Club Ops and Supply Chain end users.
 * Provide insight into data disturbances or inefficacies within process caused by poor data quality.
 * Monitor process specific KPI’s to identify trends which may be impacted by data quality.
 * Ensure communication and adherence to the defined data standards and business rules of the organization.
 * Documents existing processes, identifying gaps, and provide process improvements and/or enhancements.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in related discipline (Business Administration or Information Management) and/or demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities through previous experience
 * 2-4 years of Retail experience is preferred
 * A proven track record working as a Master Data analyst
 * SAP or similar ERP system experience is required
 * Enterprise Data Management experience is required
 * Experience with Microsoft Office Suite; Intermediate to advanced Excel skills required
 * High degree of integrity, humility and professionalism
 * Customer focused and respectful of others
 * Must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel, via email, in person and in small group settings

 * Must be able to pay close attention to complex detail and understand written and oral instructions
 * Ability to work autonomously – creating and tracking progress in an ambiguous fast paced environment
 * Outstanding planning, organizational, time management, and follow-up skills
 * Must be able to work flexible hours, including possible night and weekend, when necessary
 * Enjoy working in a fast-paced, team environment
 * Ability to work well in cross-functional teams
 * Strong problem solving, analytical and organizational skills
   
   

Job Conditions

In accordance with the Pay Transparency requirements, the following represents a good faith estimate of the compensation range for this position. At BJ’s Wholesale Club, we carefully consider a wide range of non-discriminatory factors when determining salary. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, education, experience, and qualifications. The pay range for this position is starting from $55,000.00.

description:
MANE is a 5th generation French family-owned business known for innovation and progress in the world of Flavor and Fragrance. With our passion, creativity, and innovation, “We capture what moves”.




We have an exciting opportunity to hire a Consumer Insights Analyst for our Parsippany, NJ location. In this role you will be responsible for the day-to-day project management and managing, designing, and conducting consumer, product and market research studies for Fabric and Home Care.




DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Where these objectives are relevant to job-related and job-specific roles and responsibilities, each employee shall adhere to applicable environmental policies and procedures, as well as act on best practices.

PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS:

MANE offers industry leading benefits including a generous PTO plan. description:
Job Overview

As a Data Analyst Intern you will be using databases to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

The Hubbell Summer Internship Program is a 10 to 12-week program providing students the opportunity to gain corporate experience, learn about all aspects of our business, and prepare students with the kind of experience needed to have a rewarding career at Hubbell.

Benefits Of a Hubbell Internship


 * Opportunity to apply skills and knowledge learned in the classroom to on-the-job experiences
 * Comprehensive, value-added project(s) to develop technical skills specific to your major
 * Programs and projects to help expand presentation skills
 * Exposure to various parts of the business, encouraging professional development and relationship building
   
   

A Day In The Life

Roles and Responsibilities will vary by Hubbell business location, but may include the following:


 * Reviewing current program activities to make recommendations for changes/improvement opportunities
 * Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
 * Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
 * Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases.
 * Using Power BI and other applications to create and organize data to make informed decisions, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
 * Reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct problems.
 * Extracting, cleaning, and organizing data from various sources using automated tools.
 * Other duties as assigned
   
   

Detailed roles and responsibilities will be outlined dependent on business Group, location and the project outlined

Expectations: The intern will be expected to work full-time at 40 hours/week and will be compensated on an hourly basis.

What will help you thrive in this role?


 * Student must be enrolled in an accredited university working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, or related degree
 * Basic understanding of accounting, pricing and finance principles
 * Minimum GPA requirement of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
 * Strong verbal and written communication skills
 * Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
   
   

Hubbell Incorporated

Hubbell creates critical infrastructure solutions that power our customers, communities, people and the planet. Our company is strategically aligned around enabling grid modernization and electrification. As more products plug in to an aging grid, Hubbell solutions enable the transition to a more reliable, resilient and efficient energy infrastructure. Founded in 1888 our innovation has made us a leading global manufacturer of high quality electrical and utility solutions enabling customers to operate critical infrastructure reliably and efficiently.

The company operates in two segments. Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications and Hubbell Electrical Solutions (HES) are essential to managing power across a wide range of industries and applications. Our vertical market solutions can be applied to markets including Data Centers, Renewables, Commercial Buildings, Industrial, Telecom and Transportation. Supporting both of our business segments is our corporate and Hubbell Unified Business Solutions teams that provide consistent process, tools technologies across our businesses.

We are committed to operating sustainably and ethically while promoting an inclusive and supportive culture for our people to grow and develop in their careers. Our employees proudly work and serve our communities from our headquarters in Shelton, CT, across the United States and around the globe.

Hubbell Utility Solutions

Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications. HUS provides the critical components that allow the grid to reliably transmit and distribute energy, as well as the communications and controls technologies to make the grid smarter and more flexible.

Hubbell Incorporated, its subsidiaries and affiliates, is an EO Employer AA: M/F/Veteran/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected class.

description:
Data Analytics & Integration Subject Matter Expert I (SME)

Company Overview

G&H International Services, Inc. (G&H) is a dynamic and growing company with a mission to provide innovative technology and operational solutions that support the missions of public and private sector organizations. For over 25 years, G&H has supported federal, state, and local governments across the homeland security and emergency management sectors through high-quality consulting services. Our passionate team is dedicated to building resilient communities by enhancing the capabilities of our nation's homeland security and emergency management enterprise.

Position Overview

The Data Analytics & Integration SME will support the Front Office of the Technology Scouting and Transition (TST) Division at the Department of Homeland Security's Science and Technology Directorate (DHS S&T). This remote position based in the DC metro area will work closely with program managers to integrate and configure data analytics tools to meet business requirements and align with system architecture standards.

Responsibilities include maintaining data management systems, integrating emerging technologies, and providing technical support for system analysis and assessments. This role is primarily billable and requires strong experience in data analytics, systems integration, and a background in delivering innovative consulting services in dynamic environments.

Key Responsibilities


 * Support data analytics and management functions for the Technology Scouting and Transition Division
 * Integrate and configure data analytics tools to align with architectural standards and meet business requirements
 * Manage databases and test emerging technologies for system integration
 * Revise existing systems and procedures to enhance data handling efficiency
 * Create comprehensive reports and visualizations for internal and external stakeholders
 * Provide strategic advice and technical support for system analysis and assessments
   
   

Minimum Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience, or Master's degree and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience
 * US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a federal security clearance if required
 * Proven experience in data analytics, database management, and systems integration
 * Strong knowledge of Microsoft data analytics tools, including Power BI and SharePoint
 * Familiarity with AI tools such as Microsoft Copilot
 * Experience working in a consulting or client-facing role within the public sector
   
   

Why Join G&H?

We are a small but growing company with a passion for enhancing the capabilities of our clients and building resilient communities. At G&H, you will be part of a team where your ideas and expertise are valued, and where you can make a direct impact on the success of our clients and communities. We offer competitive salaries and benefits, a supportive work environment, and opportunities for growth.

How To Apply

Submit your resume through the application link and complete all application questions.

G&H is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

G&H International Services, Inc. is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind and make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

description:
Sr. Analyst (Live Anywhere)

Excellent opportunity to capitalize on your career with a well established company and industry leaders.




You will be joining a team working on multiple initiatives, focused on building algorithms and dashboards for our internal teams.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Translate data and results into insights, actions, and recommendations
 * Basic data analytics with large volumes of data - pull and organize via Python (basic cleansing and importing)
 * Liaison and partner with offshore team
 * Apply filters from dashboards in order to tell a story with data
 * Build basic ML algorithm (regressions/forecasting)
 * Collaborate with team members (Engineering, UX, and Product Management) to create solutions
 * Forecasting models will be completed by technical resources and you will need to analyze and visualize the output to make sense of it for the business

This is a tremendous opportunity to be part of a large organization that believes in promoting talent from within. They are well-funded and willing to invest in the most cutting-edge technology and trends! This is a fantastic role that will advance your career! Enjoy a casual dress code, collaborative and high-energy team members. This is 12 month contract opportunity. You can be working remotely, but need to be able to work eastern standard hours.




Visionaire Partners offers all full-time W2 contractors a comprehensive benefits package for the contractor, their spouses/domestic partners, and dependents. Options include 401k with up to 4% match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident coverage, and both Medical and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts.



REQUIRED SKILLS:

 * 4+ years as an Analyst or Senior Analyst
 * Experience working in a retail, ecommerce or digital analytics
 * SQL - can write from scratch, manipulate complex queries, stored procedures
 * Python - basic cleansing, importing data
 * Basic data visualization in Excel, Tableau or Power BI
 * Exposure to Machine Learning - Building Regression or Forecasting Algorithms
 * Experience with insight generation - collecting, organizing, and analyzing data to gain new understanding and generate insights
 * Experience telling a story with data and communicate complex ideas to both technical and non-technical end users
 * Can provide proven examples where they have found correlation or trends with data to drive recommendations
 * Experience with JIRA or similar tracking tool
 * Bachelor's Degree in related field

Must be eligible to work in the US without Visa sponsorship or transfer.

description:
Job description:

The Data Strategist guides and supports business teams, BI teams, and technical teams on important projects in design, development, implementation and management of databases and data flows.

Translates business and technical requirements into workable action plans and designs.

Analyzes the most efficient and reliable methods for acquiring data from multiple data sources.

Understands how the data is stored, and determines how it can be added to build better models.

The Data Strategist develops data strategies to address business requirements, ensuring system scalability, security, performance and reliability.

Generally has in-depth knowledge and expertise of database technologies, along with solid programming, design and system analysis skills.

Understands own work area professional concepts/standards, regulations, strategies and operating standards.

Makes decisions regarding own work approach/priorities, and follows direction.

Work is managed and often guided by precedent and/or documented procedures/regulations/professional standards with some interpretation.



Required Qualifications

 * Bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience
 * 5 years of technical and business experience
 * Ability to write complex SQL queries
 * Experience designing, developing, and testing of software applications and/or infrastructure
 * Strong communication skills
 * Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
title: Data Strategist

description:
External Description

Audubon is currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our team in our Canonsburg, PA Office. As a Data Analyst and front-end visualization developer at Audubon, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports that empower data-driven decision making across Commercial and Asset Management teams. You will be responsible for the effective presentation and visualizations of data from various sources and provide front-end analytics capabilities. The Data Analyst shall also possess the ability to skillfully communicate with developers, architects, and business stakeholders.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:


 * Proven experience in working with Power Platform tools (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate) in order to develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports, as well as streamline data processes and workflows
 * Proven experience in the ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) process using SQL and Azure Data Factory (ADF)
 * Advanced proficiency managing and optimizing SQL databases for efficient data retrieval, manipulation, and analysis
 * Proven ability to create data models and visualizations to support business decision-making
 * Familiarity leveraging SAP systems to integrate and analyze data relevant to manufacturing facilities
 * Ability to work within Agile teams, utilizing Azure DevOps for project management and collaboration
 * Ability to grasp the business needs within the Power BI framework and devise a data model to translate raw data into
 * actionable insights
 * Ability to collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications
 * Comfortable presenting data insights and visualizations to stakeholders and business users, ensuring clarity and actionable outcomes
 * Ability to write functional requirements and technical design documents
 * Devise, implement, and roll out business intelligence solutions utilizing SQL queries, filters, and graphics to comprehensively analyze data at various levels, thereby enhancing performance and offering recommendations
 * History performing in Data Analysis and Data Visualization roles
   
   

EXPERIENCE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:


 * Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, MIS, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or other quantitative degree, preferably from an ABET accredited institution.
 * Minimum 5+ years in a technical leadership or contractual role with hands on experience with Data Analysis.
 * Ability to execute and lead multiple projects or large initiatives simultaneously.
 * Ability to generate and maintain a schedule for projects and initiatives.
 * Understands many other aspects of business analytics, data acquisition, and how to optimize presentation for stakeholders.
 * Ability to create or enhance CI/CD builds to release pipelines.
 * Ability to independently find a solution for, or to deal proactively with, work related problems.
 * Ability to comprehend instructions and request clarification as necessary.
 * Ability to lead in a team oriented environment.
 * Excellent grammar, punctuation, and etiquette desired.
 * Willingness to learn new platforms and new technologies.
 * Must be very organized, detail oriented, with the ability to identify outliers quickly.
 * Must be self-motivated, innovative, and adept in championing new initiatives in order to drive those initiatives to finality.
 * Ability to follow and perform work in accordance with company and customer HSE policy.
   
   

No Recruiters, please!

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

description:
Join Refonte (Refonte AI) Data Analytics Internship Program!

Refonte (Refonte AI) is a globally recognized IT and Ed-tech leader committed to innovation, excellence, and empowering aspiring data analytics professionals worldwide. We specialize in digital marketing, data science, data analytics, UI/UX design, web development, and app development, driving impactful solutions across diverse industries. Now, we’re offering a unique opportunity for ambitious individuals to master data analytics through hands-on experience in real-world projects with a global team.




🌐 Explore more about us here: https://refontelearning.com/




Position: Data Analytics Training and Intern | Location: Remote, USA




Who Should Apply?

If you’re passionate about data analytics, eager to learn from industry experts, and looking to gain practical experience in a flexible, collaborative environment, this internship is for you! Join a global team spanning Oceania, Asia, Europe, and the Americas and work on real data analytics projects that will build your skills from foundational to advanced levels.




Projects You’ll Work On:

 * Excel Data Visualization: Visualize a hospital dataset using Excel for impactful insights.
 * Statistical Analysis: Analyze live stock price data to explore company performance.
 * Risk Analytics Case Study: Conduct exploratory data analysis to minimize lending risk.
 * Bike-Sharing System Study: Analyze data on bike-sharing trends and usage patterns.
 * IPL Data Analysis: Dive into Indian Premier League cricket data for analytical insights.
 * Data Communication: Present key findings and insights for decision-making.
 * Global Movie Release Strategy: Collaborate on a strategic global release for RSVP Movies in 2024.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Collaborate with data science experts to collect, clean, and analyze diverse datasets, enhancing your skills in data preprocessing and visualization.
 * Utilize machine learning and data mining techniques to uncover insights, including Excel interface structuring and more.
 * Apply Python programming for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in real business contexts, focusing on risk analytics in banking and finance.
 * Design tests, optimize model performance, and explore no-code database solutions for enhanced data processing.
 * Contribute to building machine learning pipelines for applications across commerce, finance, and more.
 * Work closely with internal teams to explore business data, test hypotheses, and assess the impact of strategies using statistical methods.
 * Develop innovative solutions using modeling technologies and tackle challenges in areas like bike-share systems.
 * Gain proficiency in Tableau and other tools for complex data visualizations.
 * Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate your analytical processes and insights effectively.




What We’re Looking For:

 * Education: Pursuing a degree that demonstrates your commitment to continuous learning in data analytics or a related field.
 * Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal skills are essential for collaborating effectively and presenting complex ideas clearly.
 * Teamwork & Independence: Ability to work independently and as a collaborative team member, demonstrating adaptability and teamwork skills.




Why Join Us? This is more than just an internship; it's an opportunity to build a solid foundation in data analytics, gain practical skills with real data, and grow your network with professionals from around the globe. By the end of the program, you’ll be prepared to excel in data analytics roles across various industries.




Application Process: Upon applying, our team will reach out with the next steps and joining instructions.




🌐 Learn More: https://refontelearning.com/




Location: Remote, USA




Ready to Launch Your Career in Data Analytics? Start your journey with Refonte AI and develop the skills that will define the future of data analytics

title: Data and Reporting Professional

description:
BI Analyst #2437




Position Summary:




Our partner, a forward-thinking institution that combines innovation and education to provide high-quality, hands-on training and career readiness programs in the healthcare sector, is seeking a BI Analyst to join their team. In this position, you will analyze the data for operational business reporting. You will collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, extract and analyze data from various platforms, and create actionable reports. You will play a key role in providing valuable insights and supporting data-driven decision-making across the organization. Therefore, the ideal candidate should have a strong analytical mindset, excellent data manipulation skills, and a passion for transforming data into actionable business intelligence.




Experience and Education:




 * Bachelor or higher degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related technical field/experience.
 * 3+ years of experience as a BI Analyst or in a similar data-focused role.
 * Proficiency in SQL and data querying languages to extract and manipulate data.
 * Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and how to design effective data structures for reporting and analysis.
 * Previous experience with programming languages as Python, R or .Net (a plus).




Skills and Strengths:




 * SQL
 * Microsoft SQL
 * PostgreSQL
 * SQL queries
 * Data warehouse
 * Data visualization
 * Data modeling
 * Data structures
 * Statistical analysis
 * ETL processes
 * ETL tools
 * API-based data extraction
 * Tableau
 * Looker
 * Yellowfin
 * Power BI
 * Dundas
 * QlikView
 * Qlik sense
 * Apache superset
 * Amazon QuickSight
 * Python (a plus)
 * R (plus)
 * .Net (plus)




Primary Job Responsibilities:




 * Work closely with business stakeholders to understand and identify their data needs and document reporting requirements.
 * Collect and consolidate data from various source systems, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
 * Utilize data analysis techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
 * Design and develop interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations, ensuring data quality and integrity, to provide valuable insights to stakeholders.
 * Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and challenges, providing quick and insightful solutions.
 * Develop predictive models and forecasting tools to anticipate future trends and outcomes, helping in strategic planning.
 * Participate in the maintenance of data models, data structures, and data warehouses to optimize data retrieval and reporting efficiency.
 * Identify opportunities to improve data-related processes, data quality, and reporting efficiency, resolving data discrepancies or inconsistencies.
 * Conduct root cause analysis to identify underlying factors driving business outcomes or issues, assisting in decision-making and problem-solving.
 * Collaborate with managers and executives to support strategic planning initiatives by providing analytical support for their decision-making processes.
 * Stay updated with the latest BI trends, tools, and technologies, incorporating best practices into work, to improve reporting capabilities.

description:
Key Skills:




 * 5+ years of experience in data governance.
 * Expertise in using data governance tools such as Informatica (IDMC) for data cataloging and advanced proficiency in Excel.
 * Stakeholder Collaboration: Liaise between data users, technical teams, and business leaders to align data accessibility with the strategic needs of the actuarial department.




As a Data Governance Specialist, you will support our insurance client's actuarial department by managing and overseeing the data assets. Your primary responsibilities will include cataloging data using IDMC, creating and maintaining master data mappings in Excel, and ensuring that our data governance practices comply with both industry standards and regulatory requirements.




Role & Responsibilities Overview:

 * Data Cataloging: Utilize IDMC to effectively catalog data assets, ensuring robust metadata management and enhancing data discoverability across the organization.
 * Master Data Management: Develop, validate, and maintain detailed mappings and schemas in Excel to manage master data critical for actuarial analysis and compliance reporting.
 * Data Quality Assurance: Regularly audit and refine data quality, collaborating with IT, actuarial teams, and other stakeholders to rectify discrepancies and maintain high data integrity.
 * Have a track record of applying Data Scanning, Data Lineage, Data Quality and Data Dictionary capabilities to a global organization
 * Create and maintain technical documentation in support of data governance program
 * User Onboarding and Access Management: Oversee the onboarding process for new users, ensuring they have appropriate access to data assets and tools.
 * Maintain user access controls and regularly review permissions to ensure compliance with data governance policies.
 * Strong organizational skills with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and with changing priorities and the ability to effectively prioritize multiple tasks to meet tight deadlines.
 * Policy Implementation and Compliance: Adhere to and enforce strict data management practices that comply with industry regulations such as GDPR, HIPAA, or specific insurance regulatory standards.
 * Stakeholder Collaboration: Liaise between data users, technical teams, and business leaders to align data accessibility with the strategic needs of the actuarial department.
 * Project Leadership: Manage and execute data governance projects, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives and timely completion.
 * Educational Workshops and Support: Conduct training sessions and provide ongoing support for Alation and Excel-related data governance practices.
 * Team player with a highly motivated, positive, and collaborative attitude.
 * Excellent verbal and written communications, presentations skills, and high attention to detail.




Candidate Profile:

 * Bachelors degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or a related field.
 * 5+ years of experience in data governance
 * Experience in the insurance industry will be a plus.
 * Expertise in using data governance tools for data cataloging and advanced proficiency in Excel.
 * Familiarity with insurance data standards and the regulatory environment affecting the actuarial functions.
 * Excellent analytical, organizational, and project management skills.
 * Effective communication and interpersonal abilities, with experience working in consultancy and client-facing roles

description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Senior Data Analyst

Location: Bentonville, AR

Are you ready to join a team that works to support various functions of the eDiscovery workflow for the world's largest retailer? The Senior, Data Analyst role sits within the Global Governance Strategy & Operations team and will serve an important role helping to manage eDiscovery efforts for key Litigation and Global Investigation stakeholders. This position requires you to be a solid communicator that brings a positive attitude and strong organizational skills to a fast-paced and collaborative team.

Key Responsibilities


 * Leverage data and analytics to proactively identify trends, spot risks, and manage performance of the internal team and our external service providers
 * Collaborate directly with the Director of eDiscovery and other stakeholders to proactively address risk and engage on the defensibility and strategic direction of the eDiscovery program
   
   

What You'll Bring


 * You are comfortable building relationships, leveraging internal partnerships, and working collaboratively on cross-functional teams
 * You are process-minded and actively seek out opportunities for improved efficiency, automation, and effectiveness
 * You have strong verbal and written communication skills and can confidently interact with senior leadership and stakeholders
   
   

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

Benefits & Perks

Beyond a great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Who We Are

At Walmart, we help people save money so they can live better. This mission serves as the foundation for every decision we make, from responsible sourcing to sustainability-and everything in between. As a Walmart associate, you will play an integral role in shaping the future of retail, tech, merchandising, finance and hundreds of other industries-all while affecting the lives of millions of customers all over the world. Here, your work makes an impact every day. What are you waiting for?

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .

Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.

For Information About Benefits And Eligibility, See One.Walmart .

The annual salary range for this position is $80,000.00-$155,000.00

Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Bonuses.

Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:


 * Stock
   
   

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 2 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Option 3: 4 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications...

title: Senior, Data Analyst

description:
Who we are

Typeform is a refreshingly different form builder. We help over 150,000 businesses collect the data they need with forms, surveys, and quizzes that people enjoy. Designed to look striking and feel effortless to fill out, Typeform drives 500 million responses every year—and integrates with essential tools like Slack, Zapier, and Hubspot.

About the Team:

At Typeform, the Data team is making data our #1 asset. And we know how important that is— our product helps people collect information in the best way possible, by making it conversational.

About the Role:

As a Senior Data Analyst at Typeform, your mission will be to work with stakeholders to parametrize and explain business performance with meaningful and interpretable metrics. You will play a pivotal role in leveraging data to provide actionable insights that will enable the GTM department to make more informed decisions, optimize performance, and drive growth for the company.

Things you’ll do:


 * Be a strategic partner: Our data Analytics organization is a key enabler of the company’s overarching strategy and Product-Led Growth motion, not a service task for tactical questions. With that in mind, this role will work closely with cross-functional teams (i.e. Marketing, Product, and Sales) to align analytics initiatives with overall business objectives. Above and beyond performing the analysis itself, this role will help ensure we are ideating about and ultimately tackling the most impactful infrastructure and analysis challenges, and taking the right big bets together with the business.
 * Act as a critical conduit and translator for the business: define and gather data from multiple sources in collaboration with the Tracking and Data Engineering teams, subsequently ensuring that we can answer Typeform’s most pressing questions and ultimately calculate and analyze our most critical metrics in a standardized way
 * Drive impactful insights for the business: utilize SQL and/or Python to perform deep dive exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, inherently improving our Go-to-Market (GTM) strategy and/or Product roadmap by better understanding the needs and tendencies of our customers
 * Enable self-service at scale: as repeatable questions are defined and translated into metrics, create and automate reports/dashboards (in Looker) to help non-technical partners understand and act on the health of the business
 * Help guide and drive experimentation: actively partner with the business to help design and conduct A/B testing, as well as help analyze results to optimize marketing campaigns and strategies (in Growthbook and/or Amplitude)
   
   

What you already bring to the table:


 * You have experience working in a B2B SaaS company
 * You possess an analytical mindset and you have the ability to dissect complex problems, break them down into manageable components, and apply logical reasoning to derive insights from data.
 * You are experienced in building queries with SQL and capable of analyzing data using Python or R
 * You have experience communicating with team members across all areas of the organization.
 * You have experience partnering directly with Go To Market teams and organizations (i.e. Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Support, etc.)
   
   

Extra awesome:


 * You have deep experience in marketing sciences (attribution, experimentation, personalization)
 * You are an expert on Python.
 * You have experience with dbt.
 * You have experience building dashboards in Looker and/or Tableau.
 * Experience with AWS Redshift and/or other cloud data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery).
   
   

No one likes a guessing game — that’s why we listed the salary range for this role. Plus, we offer a 5-10% bonus on top of that, depending on your level and performance. We keep it general so to start because we use the interview process to determine the ideal level and total compensation for you based on your location, education, experience, knowledge, and skills. We also want to make sure pay is equitable across your team and that it aligns with market data, but let us worry about those details. We’re all about keeping things clear and honest, so feel free to ask us any questions along the way!

Pay range

$125,000—$184,000 USD


 * Typeform drives hundreds of millions of interactions each year, enabling conversational, human-centered experiences across the globe. We move as one team, empowering our collective efforts by valuing each individual’s unique perspective. This fosters strong bonds grounded in respect, transparency, and trust. We champion our diverse customer base by anticipating their needs and addressing their challenges with priority. Committed to excellence, we hold high expectations for ourselves and each other, continuously striving to deliver exceptional results.
   
   

We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and stand firmly against discrimination and harassment of any kind—whether based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Everyone is welcome here.

description:
Job ID: 504142
CRH's Americas Materials, a division of CRH, is the leading vertically integrated supplier of aggregates, asphalt, ready mixed concrete and paving and construction services in North America. Our operations span North America with over 28,000 employees at close to 1,600 locations in 43 US States and 2 Canadian provinces.
Position Overview
The IT Senior Business Data Analyst will collaborate with Business and Information Technology stakeholders to gain a better understanding of the structure, policies and operations across the organization to ensure delivery of high performing customer facing technology solutions. This individual will work in Data and Analytics organization (DnA) and report to the Atlanta Corporate office in a hybrid capacity.
Key Responsibilities (Essential Duties And Functions)
To perform this job satisfactorily, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
Leadership Functions

 * Accountable for maximizing the value of the product resulting from the work of the team
 * Develop and explicitly communicate the Product goal
 * Create and clearly communicate the Product Backlog items and Project requirements
 * Ordering the Product Backlog items
 * Ensuring that the Product Backlog is transparent, visible and understood
 * Foster Teamwork across teams
 * Puts the team before themselves
   

Business Data Analyst Functions

 * Manage project requirements from initiation through definition of done including: managing scope, resolving roadblocks, eliciting and delivering requirements, communication, testing, and training while promoting best practices and standards.
 * Engage with all project stakeholders both internally and externally including Executive and IT Management, Project Sponsor, Product Owner, Subject Matter Experts and additional required resources to continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships
 * Responsible for eliciting requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process mapping and descriptions, build vs buy analysis, task and workflow analysis for critical evaluation of information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
 * Create and deliver artifacts derived from functional requirements utilizing: Business Requirement Documents, Diagrams, User Stories and Mockups for development and subject matter acceptance to establish the technical vision and balance usability and performance needs
 * Clearly communicate to and share accountability for project results, progress, risks, expectations, timelines, milestones and other key project metrics with all project stakeholders
 * Assist in coordination, leading and/or participating in the testing process and UAT
 * Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements
 * Capture simple to complex business logic and transformation calculations and translate them to overall project deliverables
 * Generate data lineage and Transformations logic from industry standard ETL tools and add that as part of the playbook
 * Capture Data Quality rules and provide to development team to be included for reconciliation process
 * Create and maintain processes to generate accurate and timely reports that help stakeholders understand and act on key data insights
 * Assist Product Owner with user story creation and backlog management ("Service to the Product Owner")
 * Assist Product Owner and Lead Developer in executing showcases
 * Responsible for developing internal and external communications related to releases and product demos
   

Education/Experience
Qualifications

 * Certified Scrum Master (CSM) a plus
 * Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) a plus
 * Certified Product Owner (CPO) a plus
 * Bachelor's degree in IT, business, or computer science
 * 5-7 years’ experience eliciting and documenting requirements, including business requirements, functional requirements & technical requirements.
 * 3+ Years of experience writing SQL queries for data analysis
 * 3+ Years of experience working as a business analyst in Data and Analytics organizations.
 * Experience working on Cloud Datawarehouse platform (Snowflake, Azure Synapse etc.)
 * PC skills and hands-on experience building tools and presentations with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Access.
   

Work Requirements

 * Must be 18 years in age or older.
 * Must pass pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check.
 * Strict adherence to safety requirements and procedures as outlined in the Employee Handbook.
 * Willingness to work independently within in a team environment and assist the team with other duties as required.
 * Must be available to travel up to 10%
   

Physical Requirements
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 * Able to communicate with others by telephone and in person.
 * Able to utilize a computer for word processing, email communication, and preparation of documents and presentations.
 * May require sitting for extended periods of time.
   

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

 * Usually, normal office working conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.
 * The position may require work outside of normal business hours.
   

The statements included in this job description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job. Other duties may be assigned as required. Requirements for this job are subject to modification by the Company and its designees, and reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
What CRH Offers You

 * Highly competitive base pay
 * Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
 * Group retirement savings program
 * Health and wellness programs
 * A diverse and inclusive culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion
   

About CRH
CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of a large international organization.
If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!
CRH Americas Materials Inc. is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

When you join the team at Unum, you become part of an organization committed to helping you thrive.

Benefits

Here, we work to provide the employee benefits and service solutions that enable employees at our client companies to thrive throughout life’s moments. And this starts with ensuring that every one of our team members enjoys opportunities to succeed both professionally and personally. To enable this, we provide:


 * Award-winning culture

 * Student loan repayment options

 * Flexible work environments

And that’s just the beginning…

With 10,000 employees helping more than 39 million people worldwide, every role at Unum is meaningful and impacts the lives of our customers. Whether you’re directly supporting a growing family, or developing online tools to help navigate a difficult loss, customers are counting on the combined talents of our entire team. Help us help others, and join Team Unum today!

General Summary

General Summary

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for simple to moderately complex data analysis, metric preparation, and visualization. The successful candidate will possess a strong blend of technical, analytical, data, and business proficiencies spanning Financial and Operational issue areas. They will serve as a critical bridge between data and analytics development and stakeholders to help optimize business operational performance. The ideal candidate will also have both a passion for and proven track record of implementing process improvements focused on leveraging modern technology tools and approaches.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities


 * Build strong partnerships with stakeholders in order to develop knowledge of their operational areas including their workflow, business management systems and data.
 * Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and validate output to ensure solutions will meet their expectations.
 * Conduct data profiling and analysis to evaluate data sources to determine the best source for business information.
 * Acquire, transform, and translate data into meaningful metrics, actionable dashboards, and database assets with moderate support from mentor and manager.
 * Continuously develop and build upon existing knowledge of the insurance industry.
 * Continuously develop and build upon existing knowledge of data stored in company databases.
 * Develop strong partnerships with technology teams in DTO and Finance to ensure up-to-date methods and technologies are employed within the organization.
 * Collaborate with data engineers to perform data validation and testing activities as appropriate.
   
   

~IN1

Unum and Colonial Life are part of Unum Group, a Fortune 500 company and leading provider of employee benefits to companies worldwide. Headquartered in Chattanooga, TN, with international offices in Ireland, Poland and the UK, Unum also has significant operations in Portland, ME, and Baton Rouge, LA - plus over 35 US field offices. Colonial Life is headquartered in Columbia, SC, with over 40 field offices nationwide.

The base salary range for applicants for this position is listed below. Unless actual salary is indicated above in the job description, actual pay will be based on skill, geographical location and experience.

$60,500.00-$123,400.00

Additionally, Unum offers a portfolio of benefits and rewards that are competitive and comprehensive including healthcare benefits (health, vision, dental), insurance benefits (short & long-term disability), performance-based incentive plans, paid time off, and a 401(k) retirement plan with an employer match up to 5% and an additional 4.5% contribution whether you contribute to the plan or not. All benefits are subject to the terms and conditions of individual Plans.

Company

Unum
